(i);$$\begin{align};  & \frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ \cos {\ln( 1+x )} \right] \\ ; & =-\sin { \ln \left( 1+x \right) }\frac{1}{1+x} \\ ; & \therefore \left( 1+x \right)\frac{dy}{dx}=-\sin x{ \ln \left( 1+x \right)} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii);$$\begin{align};  & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ \left( 1+x \right)\frac{dy}{dx} \right]=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ -\sin{ \ln \left( 1+x \right)} \right] \\ ; & \left( 1+x \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\frac{dy}{dx}=-\cos { \ln \left( 1+x \right)}\frac{1}{1+x} \\ ; & {{\left( 1+x \right)}^{2}}\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 1+x \right)\frac{dy}{dx}+\cos {\ln \left( 1+x \right)}=0 \\ ; & {{\left( 1+x \right)}^{2}}\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 1+x \right)\frac{dy}{dx}+y=0 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;$$\begin{align};  & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{\left( 1+x \right)}^{2}}\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 1+x \right)\frac{dy}{dx}+y \right]=0 \\ ; & {{\left( 1+x \right)}^{2}}\frac{{{d}^{3}}y}{d{{x}^{3}}}+2\left( 1+x \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 1+x \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\frac{dy}{dx}+\frac{dy}{dx}=0 \\ ; & \therefore {{\left( 1+x \right)}^{2}}\frac{{{d}^{3}}y}{d{{x}^{3}}}+3\left( 1+x \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+2\frac{dy}{dx}=0 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Let \[f = f(x) = \cos{\ln(1+x)}\];Maclaurin's series for \[y=f(x)\] is;$$\begin{align};  & y=f\left( 0 \right)+f'\left( 0 \right)x+\frac{f''\left( 0 \right)}{2!}{{x}^{2}}+\frac{f'''\left( 0 \right)}{3!}{{x}^{3}}+... \\ ; & f\left( 0 \right)=\cos{ \ln \left( 1+0 \right)}=1 \\ ; & \left( 1+0 \right)f'\left( 0 \right)=-\sin { \ln \left( 1+0 \right)} \\ ; & \Rightarrow f'\left( 0 \right)=0 \\ ; & {{\left( 1+0 \right)}^{2}}f''\left( 0 \right)+\left( 1+0 \right)f'\left( 0 \right)+f\left( 0 \right)=0 \\ ; & \Rightarrow f''\left( 0 \right)+0+1=0 \\ ; & \Rightarrow f''\left( 0 \right)=-1 \\ ; & {{\left( 1+0 \right)}^{2}}f'''\left( 0 \right)+3\left( 1+0 \right)f''\left( 0 \right)+2f'\left( 0 \right)=0 \\ ; & \Rightarrow f'''\left( 0 \right)+3\left( -1 \right)+0=0 \\ ; & \Rightarrow f'''\left( 0 \right)=3 \\ ; & \therefore y=1+\left( 0 \right)x+\frac{-1}{2!}{{x}^{2}}+\frac{3}{3!}{{x}^{3}}+... \\ ; & =1-\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{2}}+\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{3}}+... \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Using standard series expansions,;$$\begin{align};  & \cos { \ln \left( 1+x \right)} \\ ; & =1-\frac{\ln \left( 1+x \right)^{2}}{2!}+... \\ ; & =1-\frac{1}{2}{{\left[ x-\frac{{{x}^{2}}}{2}+... \right]}^{2}}+... \\ ; & =1-\frac{1}{2}\left[ {{x}^{2}}-{{x}^{3}}+... \right] \\ ; & =1-\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{2}}+\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{3}}+... \\ ;\end{align}$$;

a);$$\begin{align};  & \sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{\left( {{3}^{r-1}}+2r \right)} \\ ; & =\sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{{{3}^{r-1}}}+2\sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{r} \\ ; & =\left[ {{3}^{0}}+{{3}^{1}}+{{3}^{2}}+...+{{3}^{n-1}} \right]+2\left[ \frac{1}{2}n\left( n+1 \right) \right] \\ ; & =\frac{g\left( {{r}^{n}}-1 \right)}{r-1}+n\left( n+1 \right) \\ ; & =\frac{1\left( {{3}^{n}}-1 \right)}{3-1}+n\left( n+1 \right) \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}\left( {{3}^{n}}-1 \right)+n\left( n+1 \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;b);(i) Let $$P_n$$ denotes;$$\begin{align};  & \sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{\left( {{r}^{3}}+3{{r}^{5}} \right)}=\frac{1}{2}{{n}^{3}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{3}} \\ ; & n=1, \\ ; & LHS=\sum\limits_{r=1}^{1}{\left( {{r}^{3}}+3{{r}^{5}} \right)}=\left[ {{1}^{3}}+3{{\left( 1 \right)}^{5}} \right]=4 \\ ; & RHS=\frac{1}{2}{{\left( 1 \right)}^{3}}{{\left( 1+1 \right)}^{3}}=4=LHS \\ ;\end{align}$$;;$$P_1$$ is true;Assume $$P_k$$ is true for $$k\in {{Z}^{+}}$$;$$\sum\limits_{r=1}^{k}{\left( {{r}^{3}}+3{{r}^{5}} \right)}=\frac{1}{2}{{k}^{3}}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}$$;For n= k + 1;$$\begin{align};  & RHS=\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}{{\left[ \left( k+1 \right)+1 \right]}^{3}} \\ ; & LHS=\sum\limits_{r=1}^{k+1}{\left( {{r}^{3}}+3{{r}^{5}} \right)} \\ ; & =\sum\limits_{r=1}^{k}{\left( {{r}^{3}}+3{{r}^{5}} \right)}+{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}+3{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{5}} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{k}^{3}}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}+{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}+3{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{5}} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}\left[ {{k}^{3}}+2+6{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{2}} \right] \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}\left[ {{k}^{3}}+2+6\left( {{k}^{2}}+2k+1 \right) \right] \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}\left[ {{k}^{3}}+6{{k}^{2}}+12k+8 \right] \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}\left[ \left( k+2 \right)\left( {{k}^{2}}+4k+4 \right) \right] \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}\left[ \left( k+2 \right){{\left( k+2 \right)}^{2}} \right] \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}{{\left[ k+2 \right]}^{3}} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{\left( k+1 \right)}^{3}}{{\left[ \left( k+1 \right)+1 \right]}^{3}}=RHS \\ ;\end{align}$$;;$$P_{k+1}$$ is true if $$P_k$$ is true;Therefore, by mathematical induction, $$P_n$$ is true for all $$n\in {{Z}^{+}}$$;;(ii) Given ;\[\begin{align};  & \sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{{{r}^{3}}}=\frac{1}{4}{{n}^{2}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{2}} \\ ; &  \\ ; & \sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{\left( {{r}^{3}}+3{{r}^{5}} \right)}=\frac{1}{2}{{n}^{3}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{3}} \\ ; & \sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{{{r}^{3}}}+3\sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{{{r}^{5}}}=\frac{1}{2}{{n}^{3}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{3}} \\ ; & 3\sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{{{r}^{5}}}=\frac{1}{2}{{n}^{3}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{3}}-\sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{{{r}^{3}}} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}{{n}^{3}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{3}}-\frac{1}{4}{{n}^{2}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{2}} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{4}{{n}^{2}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{2}}\left[ 2n\left( n+1 \right)-1 \right] \\ ; & =\frac{1}{4}{{n}^{2}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{2}}\left[ 2{{n}^{2}}+2n-1 \right] \\ ; & \therefore \sum\limits_{r=1}^{n}{{{r}^{5}}}=\frac{1}{12}{{n}^{2}}{{\left( n+1 \right)}^{2}}\left( 2{{n}^{2}}+2n-1 \right) \\ ;\end{align}\]

a);img;;(i) Sine rule on $$\vartriangle ABD$$:;$$\begin{align};  & \frac{x}{\sin \alpha }=\frac{c}{\sin \theta } \\ ; & \therefore x=\frac{c\sin \alpha }{\sin \theta } \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii) Sine rule on $$\vartriangle ACD$$:;$$\begin{align};  & \frac{y}{\sin \alpha }=\frac{b}{\sin \left( \pi -\theta  \right)}\\ ; & \therefore y=\frac{b\sin \alpha }{\sin \left(\pi - \theta \right)} \\ ; & \therefore \frac{x}{y}= \frac{\left( \frac{c\sin \alpha }{\sin \theta } \right)}{\left( \frac{b\sin \alpha }{\sin \left(\pi - \theta \right) } \right)}=\frac{\left( \frac{c\sin \alpha }{\sin \theta } \right)}{\left( \frac{b\sin \alpha }{\sin \theta } \right)}=\frac{c}{b} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;b);$$\begin{align};  & \vartriangle EFG: \\ ; & EF=\sqrt{F{{G}^{2}}+E{{G}^{2}}}=\sqrt{{{1}^{2}}+{{1}^{2}}}=\sqrt{2} \\ ; & FH=FG-z=1-z \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(i);$$\begin{align};  & \frac{FH}{HG}=\frac{EF}{EG} \\ ; & \frac{1-z}{z}=\frac{\sqrt{2}}{1} \\ ; & \therefore z\sqrt{2}=1-z \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii);img;        ;$$\begin{align};  & z\sqrt{2}=1-z \\ ; & z\sqrt{2}+z=1 \\ ; & \therefore z=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}+1} \\ ; & \angle GEH=\frac{1}{2}\angle FEG=\frac{1}{2}\left( {{45}^{\circ}} \right)=22{{\frac{1}{2}}^{\circ}} \\ ; & \tan \angle GEH=\frac{GH}{EG}=\frac{z}{1}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}+1} \\ ; & \therefore \tan 22{{\frac{1}{2}}^{\circ}}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}+1} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;c) ;Let the bisector of $$\angle QPR$$ meets QR at S. ;img;         ;$$\begin{align};  & QR=QP\sin {{30}^{\circ}} \\ ; & =\left( 2 \right)\left( \frac{1}{2} \right)=1 \\ ; & PR=\sqrt{Q{{P}^{2}}-Q{{R}^{2}}}=\sqrt{{{2}^{2}}-{{1}^{2}}}=\sqrt{3} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;;\[\begin{align};  & \frac{QS}{SR}=\frac{PQ}{PR} \\ ; & \frac{1-SR}{SR}=\frac{2}{\sqrt{3}} \\ ; & \sqrt{3}\left( 1-SR \right)=2SR \\ ; & 2SR+\sqrt{3}SR=\sqrt{3} \\ ; & \therefore SR=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2+\sqrt{3}} \\ ; & \angle SPR=\frac{1}{2}\angle QPR=\frac{1}{2}\left( {{30}^{\circ}} \right)={{15}^{\circ}} \\ ; & \tan \angle SPR=\frac{SR}{PR}=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2+\sqrt{3}}\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}=\frac{1}{2+\sqrt{3}} \\ ; & \therefore \tan {{15}^{\circ}}=\frac{1}{2+\sqrt{3}} \\ ;\end{align}\]

a);Let $$\frac{17{{x}^{2}}+23x+12}{\left( 3x+4 \right)\left( {{x}^{2}}+4 \right)}\equiv \frac{A}{3x+4}+\frac{Bx+C}{{{x}^{2}}+4}$$;Clearing the fractions:;$$\begin{align};  & 17{{x}^{2}}+23x+12 \\ ; & \equiv A\left( {{x}^{2}}+4 \right)+\left( Bx+C \right)\left( 3x+4 \right) \\ ; & \equiv \left( A+3B \right){{x}^{2}}+\left( 4B+3C \right)x+\left( 4A+4C \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Cover-up rule:;$$x=-\frac{4}{3}:A=\frac{17{{\left( -\frac{4}{3} \right)}^{2}}+23\left( -\frac{4}{3} \right)+12}{{{\left( -\frac{4}{3} \right)}^{2}}+4}=2$$;Comparing coefficients:;$$\begin{align};  & {{x}^{2}}:17=A+3B \\ ; & \Rightarrow 17=\left( 2 \right)+3B\Rightarrow B=5 \\ ; & {{x}^{0}}:12=4A+4C \\ ; & \Rightarrow 12=4\left( 2 \right)+4C\Rightarrow C=1 \\ ; & \therefore \frac{17{{x}^{2}}+23x+12}{\left( 3x+4 \right)\left( {{x}^{2}}+4 \right)}\equiv \frac{2}{3x+4}+\frac{5x+1}{{{x}^{2}}+4} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;b);N.A

$$\begin{align};  & \cos \left( A+B \right)=\cos A\cos B-\sin A\sin B \\ ; & \cos \left( x+x \right)=\cos x\cos x-\sin x\sin x \\ ; & \cos 2x={{\cos }^{2}}x-{{\sin }^{2}}x--------(1) \\ ; & ={{\cos }^{2}}x-\left( 1-{{\cos }^{2}}x \right)=2{{\cos }^{2}}x-1 \\ ; & 2{{\cos }^{2}}x=1+\cos 2x \\ ; & \therefore {{\cos }^{2}}x=\frac{1}{2}\left( 1+\cos 2x \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;From eqn (1),;$$\begin{align};  & \cos 2x={{\cos }^{2}}x-{{\sin }^{2}}x=\left( 1-{{\sin }^{2}}x \right)-{{\sin }^{2}}x=1-2{{\sin }^{2}}x \\ ; & 2{{\sin }^{2}}x=1-\cos 2x \\ ; & \therefore {{\sin }^{2}}x=\frac{1}{2}\left( 1-\cos 2x \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;$$\begin{align};  & f\left( x \right)=10{{\cos }^{2}}x+2{{\sin }^{2}}x+6\sin x\cos x \\ ; & =5\left( 1+\cos 2x \right)+\left( 1-\cos 2x \right)+3\sin 2x \\ ; & =6+4\cos 2x+3\sin 2x \\ ; & \equiv Q+R\sin \left( 2x+\alpha  \right) \\ ; & =Q+R\sin 2x\cos \alpha +R\cos 2x\sin \alpha  \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Comparing coefficients:;$$\begin{align};  & {{x}^{0}}:Q=6 \\ ; & \sin 2x:R\cos \alpha =3 \\ ; & \cos 2x:R\sin \alpha =4 \\ ; & \Rightarrow R=\sqrt{{{3}^{2}}+{{4}^{2}}}=5 \\ ; & \tan \alpha =\frac{4}{3} \\ ; & \therefore f\left( x \right)=6+5\sin \left( 2x+\alpha  \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(i) Value of f(x) is greatest when $$\sin \left( 2x+\alpha  \right)=1$$;$$f{{\left( x \right)}_{greatest}}=6+5\left( 1 \right)=11$$;;Value of f(x) is least when $$\sin \left( 2x+\alpha  \right)=-1$$;$$\therefore f{{\left( x \right)}_{least}}=6+5\left( -1 \right)=1$$;;(ii) Sketch f(x) for $$0\le x\le 2\pi $$;; img

a);(i) Treating the family of 3 sitting together as 1 unit, there are 6 unit/people;No. of ways to arrange 6 unit/people = 6!;No. of ways to arrange 3 people in family =3!;Total no. of seating arrangements  = 6! x 3! = 4320;;(ii) Treating the 2 people as sitting together as 1 unit, there are 5 unit/ people;No. of ways to arrange 5 unit/people = 5!;No. of ways to arrange the 2 people = 2!;Total no. of seating arrangements with the 2 people sitting together = 5!x3!x2! = 1440;Total no. of seating arrangements with the 2 people not sitting together = 4320 - 1440 = 2880;;b);(i) With 6 bowls, each of which can be selected or not, i.e. 2 possibilities, there are 26 possible combinations (including the nil combination);;No. of different selections, (not including the nil combination);=$$2^6$$-1=63;;(ii) After selecting tomatoes, there are 3 more items to select from 5 remaining choices.;No. of different selections $$=C_{3}^{5}=10$$

(i) ;$$\begin{align};  & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ \ln \left( \sec x+\tan x \right) \right] \\ ; & =\frac{1}{\sec x+\tan x}\left( \sec x\tan x+{{\sec }^{2}}x \right) \\ ; & =\frac{1}{\sec x+\tan x}\left( \tan x+\sec x \right)\sec x \\ ; & =\sec x \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii);$$\begin{align};  & \int{x\sin xdx} \\ ; & =x\left( -\cos x \right)-\int{\left( -\cos x \right)dx}+{{c}_{1}} \\ ; & =-x\cos x+\sin x+c \\ ; & =\sin x-x\cos x+c \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(iii);\[\begin{align};  & \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi }{x\sin x\ln \left( \sec x+\tan x \right)dx} \\ ; & =\left[ \left( \sin x-x\cos x \right)\ln \left( \sec x+\tan x \right) \right]_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi }-\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi }{\left( \sin x-x\cos x \right)\left( \sec x \right)dx} \\ ; & =\left[ \left( \sin \frac{1}{4}\pi -\frac{1}{4}\pi \cos \frac{1}{4} \right)\times \ln \left( \sec \frac{1}{4}\pi -\tan \frac{1}{4} \right) \right]- \\ ; & \left[ \left( \sin \left( 0 \right)-\left( 0 \right)\cos \left( 0 \right)\ln \left( \sec \left( 0 \right)-\tan \left( 0 \right) \right) \right) \right]-\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi }{\left( \tan x-x \right)dx} \\ ; & =\left[ \left( \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}-\frac{1}{4}\pi \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \right)\ln \left( \sqrt{2}+1 \right)-\left( 0 \right)\ln \left( 1 \right) \right]-\left[ -\ln \left( \cos x \right)-\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{2}} \right]_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi } \\ ; & =\left( \frac{1}{2}-\frac{1}{4\sqrt{2}}\pi  \right)\ln \left( \sqrt{2}+1 \right)+\left[ \ln \left( \cos \frac{1}{4}\pi  \right)+\frac{1}{2}{{\left( \frac{1}{4}\pi  \right)}^{2}}-\ln \left( \cos \left( 0 \right)-\frac{1}{2}{{\left( 0 \right)}^{2}} \right) \right] \\ ; & =\left( \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}-\frac{1}{4\sqrt{2}}\pi  \right)\ln \left( \sqrt{2}+1 \right)+\left[ \ln \left( \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \right)+\frac{1}{32}{{\pi }^{2}}-0 \right] \\ ; & =\left( \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}-\frac{1}{4\sqrt{2}}\pi  \right)\ln \left( \sqrt{2}+1 \right)-\frac{1}{2}\ln 2+\frac{1}{32}{{\pi }^{2}} \\ ;\end{align}\];

(a);(i) $$K \cup H$$ represents the event that the card taken is either a King or a Heart.;$$P(K \cup H) = \frac{2 + 3 + 1 + 3 + 3 + 2}{30}$$;$$=\frac{14}{30} = \frac{7}{15}$$;;(ii) $$J' \cap H'$$ represents the event that the card taken is not a Jack and not a Heart.;$$P(J' \cap H') = \frac{2 + 1 + 3 + 3 + 5 + 2}{30}$$;$$=\frac{16}{30} = \frac{8}{15}$$;;(iii) Let D  = card taken is a Diamond.;$$P( D|K ) = \frac{P(D \cap K)}{P(K)}$$;$$=\frac{1}{2 + 3 + 1 + 3} = \frac{1}{9}$$;;(b);P( both cards are Jacks);$$=\frac{8}{30} . \frac{7}{29} = 0.0644 = 0.064$$;;(c);P( 3 Kings or 3 Queens or 3 Jacks);$$=\frac{9}{30}.\frac{8}{29}.\frac{7}{28} + \frac{13}{30}.\frac{12}{29}.\frac{11}{28} + \frac{8}{30}.\frac{7}{29}.\frac{6}{28}$$;$$= 0.1049 = 0.105$$ (ans)

$$F(4) = a\left[ 6({4})^{2} - 4^3\right]$$ and F(4) = 1;$$\Rightarrow a(32) = 1$$;$$\therefore a = \frac{1}{32}$$;;$$f(x) = \frac{d}{dx}\left[F(x)\right]$$;$$=\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{1}{32}(6{x}^{2} - {x}^{3})\right]$$ for $$0 \le x \le 4$$;$$=\frac{1}{32}(12x - 3{x}^{2}) = \frac{3}{32}(4x - {x}^{2})$$;$$\therefore$$ \[ f(x) = \left\{ ;  \begin{array}{l l};    \frac{3}{32}(4x - {x}^{2}) & \quad \text{for} 0 \le x \le 4\\;    0 & \quad \text{otherwise};  \end{array} \right.\];;f(x) is symmetrical about x = 2;$$\Rightarrow E(X) = 2$$;;$$E(X^2) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}{x}^{2}f(x)dx$$;$$=\int_{0}^{4}\left[x^2.\frac{3}{32}(4x - {x}^{2})\right]dx$$;$$=\frac{3}{32}\int_{0}^{4}(4{x}^{3} - {x}^{4})dx$$;$$=\frac{3}{32}{\left[x^4 - \frac{1}{5}x^5\right]}_{0}^{4}$$;$$=\frac{3}{32}\left[4^4 - \frac{1}{5}4^5\right] - 0 = \frac{24}{5}$$;$$\therefore Var(X) = E(X^2) - {\left[E(X)\right]}^2$$;$$=\frac{24}{5} - {2}^{2} = \frac{4}{5}$$;;Let n = no. of observations = 100;Let $$\mu$$ = E(X) = 2;Let $$\sigma^2$$ = Var(X) = $$\frac{4}{5}$$;;P( S > 185);$$\equiv P\left[(\sum\limits_{i=1}^{100}X) > 185\right] = P\left[\frac{1}{100}(\sum\limits_{i=1}^{100}X) > \frac{185}{100}\right]$$;$$\equiv P(\overline{X} > 1.85)$$;;Since n ( = 100) is large, Central Limit Theorem;$$\Rightarrow \overline{X} \sim N(\mu, {\sigma}^2/n)$$ approximately;$$P(\overline{X} > 1.85)$$;$$\equiv P( Z > \frac{1.85 - \mu}{\sigma/\sqrt{n}}) = P( Z > \frac{1.85 - 2}{\sqrt{\frac{4}{5}/100}})$$;$$=P( Z > - 1.6771) = \Phi (1.677)$$;$$= 0.9532 = 0.953$$ (ans)

(a);Let n = sample size = 225;Let p = average proportion of rockets that fail to burn properly = $$\frac{1}{75}$$;Let X = no. of rockets out of n that fail to burn properly;;Since n ( = 225) is large and np = 3 < 5,;$$X \sim Po(\lambda) \text{ approximately, where }\lambda = np = 3$$;P ( at most 221 burn properly);$$\equiv P( X \ge 4 )$$;$$= 1- P( X < 4 )$$;$$= 1 - \left[P( X = 1 ) + P( X = 2 ) + P( X = 3 ) + P( X = 0 )\right]$$;$$= 1 - e^{-\lambda}\left[\frac{\lambda^0}{0!} + \frac{\lambda^1}{1!} + \frac{\lambda^2}{2!} + \frac{\lambda^3}{3!}\right]$$;$$= 1 - e^{-3}\left[1 + 3 + \frac{3^2}{2!} + \frac{3^3}{3!}\right]$$;$$= 0.3528 = 0.353$$ (ans);;The distribution that should be used is the Binomial distribution, i.e. $$X \sim B( n,p )$$. ;;(b);Let n = sample size = 50;Let $$\mu$$ = mean burning time;Let $${\sigma}^2$$ = variance of the burning time;Let $${\mu}_{0}$$ = assumed $$\mu$$ = 40;;$$\hat{\mu} = \overline{x} = \frac{\sum ( x - c)}{n} + c$$;$$= \frac{-27}{50} + 40 = 39.46$$;;$${\hat{\sigma}}^2 = \frac{1}{n-1}\left[\sum ( x-c )^2 - \frac{1}{n}(\sum ( x-c))^2\right]$$;$$ = \frac{1}{49}\left[ (167) - \frac{1}{50}(-27)^2\right] = 3.1106$$;;Test $${H}_{0}$$ : $$\mu = {\mu}_{0}$$ against $${H}_{1}$$ : $$\mu \neq {\mu}_{0}$$;a 2 tailed test for difference;The 5% critical value, $${z}_{0.05} = 1.960$$;Reject $${H}_{0}$$ if $$| z | > | {z}_{0.05} |$$;Under $${H}_{0}$$, the test statistic is,;$$z = (\frac{\overline{x} - \mu}{\hat{\sigma}/\sqrt{n}}) = (\frac{39.46 - 40}{sqrt{3.1106/50}}) = - 2.165$$;;Since $$| z | > | {z}_{0.05} |$$, reject $${H}_{0}$$ and conclude that at 5% level of significance, there is sufficient evidence that the mean burning time differs from 40 seconds.;If the sample size is large (generally $$\ge$$ 50 ), the Central Limit Theorem implies that regardless of the population's distribution, the sample mean is approximately normally distributed. Therefore, in the above test, it is not necessary to assume, that the burning times of 'Brilliant' fireworks have a normal distribution. (ans)

(a);Let $$a = 2{e}^{\frac{1}{12}\pi i}$$ and $$b = 2{e}^{\frac{5}{12}\pi i}$$;$$\Rightarrow OA = | a | = 2$$ and  $$OB = | b | = 2$$;$$\Rightarrow OA = OB$$;;img;;$$\angle AOB$$;= arg b - arg a;$$=\frac{5}{12}\pi - \frac{1}{12}\pi$$;$$=\frac{4}{12}\pi =\frac{1}{3}\pi $$;$$\therefore \vartriangle AOB$$ is equilateral. (ans);;(b) Given $$z = Re^{\alpha i}$$ and $$w = Re^{\beta i}$$;(i) $$z + w$$;$$= Re^{\alpha i} + Re^{\beta i} = R(e^{\alpha i} + e^{\beta i})$$;$$=R\left[(\cos \alpha + i\sin \alpha) + (\cos \beta + i\sin \beta)\right]$$;$$=R\left[(\cos \alpha + \cos \beta) + i (\sin \alpha + \sin \beta)\right]$$;$$=R\left[2\cos \frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta)\cos \frac{1}{2}(\alpha - \beta) + i 2\sin \frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta)\cos \frac{1}{2}(\alpha - \beta)\right]$$;$$=2R\cos \frac{1}{2} (\alpha - \beta)\left[\cos \frac{1}{2} (\alpha + \beta) + i\sin \frac{1}{2} (\alpha + \beta)\right]$$;$$=2R\cos \frac{1}{2} (\alpha - \beta) e^{\frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta) i }$$;$$=2R\cos \frac{1}{2} (\beta - \alpha) e^{\frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta) i }$$ (ans);;(ii) $$| z + w | = 2R\cos \frac{1}{2} (\beta - \alpha)$$ (ans);$$arg( z + w ) = \frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta)$$ (ans);;$$z - w$$;$$= Re^{\alpha i} - Re^{\beta i} = R(e^{\alpha i} - e^{\beta i})$$;$$=R\left[(\cos \alpha + i\sin \alpha) - (\cos \beta + i\sin \beta)\right]$$;$$=R\left[(\cos \alpha - \cos \beta) + i (\sin \alpha - \sin \beta)\right]$$;$$=R\left[2\sin \frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta)\sin \frac{1}{2}(\alpha - \beta) + i 2\cos \frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta)\sin \frac{1}{2}(\alpha - \beta)\right]$$;$$=2R\sin \frac{1}{2} (\alpha - \beta)\left[\sin \frac{1}{2} (\alpha + \beta) + i\cos \frac{1}{2} (\alpha + \beta)\right]$$;$$=2R\sin \frac{1}{2} (\alpha - \beta)\left[\cos \theta + i\sin \theta\right]$$ ;                                                   where $$\theta = \frac{1}{2}\pi - \frac{1}{2}(\alpha + \beta) = \frac{1}{2}(\pi - \alpha - \beta)$$;$$\equiv - 2R\sin \frac{1}{2} (\beta - \alpha)\left[\cos \theta + i\sin \theta\right]$$;$$\therefore | z - w | = 2R\sin \frac{1}{2} (\beta - \alpha)$$;;Area of $$\vartriangle OZW$$,;$$\Delta = \frac{1}{2} | OZ | | OW | \sin WOZ$$;$$=\frac{1}{2}( R )( R )\sin (\beta - \alpha)$$;$$=\frac{1}{2}( R )^{2}\sin (\beta - \alpha)$$;;img;;$${z}^{2} - {w}^{2}$$;$$= (Re^{\alpha i})^2 - (Re^{\beta i})^2$$;$$=R^2e^{2\alpha i} - R^2e^{2\beta i}$$;$$=R^2(e^{2\alpha i} - e^{2\beta i})$$;$$\equiv 2R^2\sin \frac{1}{2}(2\alpha - 2\beta)\left[\cos {\theta}_{2} + i \sin {\theta}_{2}\right]$$;                                                           where $${\theta}_{2} = \frac{1}{2}(\pi - 2 \alpha - 2 \beta)$$;$$= - 2R^2\sin (\beta - \alpha)\left[\cos {\theta}_{2} + i \sin {\theta}_{2}\right]$$;$$\therefore | {z}^{2} - {w}^{2} | = 2R^2\sin (\beta - \alpha)$$;$$= 4\left[\frac{1}{2}( R )^{2}\sin (\beta - \alpha)\right] = 4\Delta$$ (ans)

(a) Topic removed from syllabus.;;(b) $$\frac{dy}{dx} = -\frac{8x + 4y + 1}{4x + 2y + 1} = -frac{ 4 (2x + y) + 1}{ 2 (2x + y) + 1}$$;With $$y = u - 2x$$   $$\equiv$$    $$u = 2x + y$$;$$\frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{du}{dx} - 2$$;;Subst into the differential equation:;$$\frac{du}{dx} - 2 = - \frac{4u + 1}{2u + 1}$$;$$\frac{du}{dx} = 2 - \frac{4u + 1}{2u + 1} = \frac{2 (2u + 1) - ( 4u + 1)}{2u + 1}$$;$$=\frac{1}{2u + 1}$$;;$$\int ( 2u + 1)du = \int dx$$;$$u^2 + u = x - c$$,    c = constant;Subst back  $$u = 2x + y$$ :;$$(2x + y)^2 + (2x + y) = x - c$$;$$4x^2 + 4xy +y^2 + 2x + y - x + c = 0$$;$$4x^2 + 4xy +y^2 + x + y + c = 0$$ (ans)

$$\overrightarrow{AA'}$$ is parallel to 5i - 12k;;$$\Rightarrow$$ Acute angle of $$AA'$$ to the vertical;;$${\theta}_{A} = {\cos }^{-1}\frac{| (5i - 12k).( k ) |}{| 5i -12k | | k |}$$;;                   $$={\cos }^{-1}\frac{| -12 |}{\sqrt{5^2 + 12^2}(1)}$$;;                   $$= 0.3948 = 0.395$$ rad;;;$$\overrightarrow{BB'}$$ is parallel to -3i + 4j - 12k;;$$\Rightarrow$$ Acute angle of $$BB'$$ to the vertical;;$${\theta}_{B} = {\cos }^{-1}\frac{| (-3i + 4j - 12k).( k ) |}{| -3i + 4j - 12k | | k |}$$;;                   $$={\cos }^{-1}\frac{| -12 |}{\sqrt{3^2 + 4^2 + 12^2}(1)}$$;;                   $$= 0.3948 = 0.395$$ rad;;;$$\overrightarrow{CC'}$$ is parallel to -3i - 4j - 12k;;$$\Rightarrow$$ Acute angle of $$CC'$$ to the vertical;;$${\theta}_{C} = {\cos }^{-1}\frac{| (-3i - 4j - 12k).( k ) |}{| -3i - 4j - 12k | | k |}$$;;                   $$={\cos }^{-1}\frac{| -12 |}{\sqrt{3^2 + 4^2 + 12^2}(1)}$$;;                   $$= 0.3948 = 0.395$$ rad;;;$$\therefore {\theta}_{A} = {\theta}_{B} = {\theta}_{C}$$ (ans);;(Second part) Topic removed from syllabus.

$$\begin{align};  & \frac{d}{dx}\left( \frac{\cos x}{1-\sin x} \right)=\frac{\left( 1-\sin x \right)\frac{d}{dx}\left[ \cos x \right]-\left( \cos x \right)\frac{d}{dx}\left[ 1-\sin x \right]}{{{\left( 1-\sin x \right)}^{2}}} \\ ; & =\frac{\left( 1-\sin x \right)\left( -\sin x \right)-\left( \cos x \right)\left( -\cos x \right)}{{{\left( 1-\sin x \right)}^{2}}} \\ ; & =\frac{1-\sin x}{{{\left( 1-\sin x \right)}^{2}}}=\frac{1}{1-\sin x} \\ ;\end{align}$$;

(i) Sketch y = f(x-a);= y = f(x) translated a units in the direction of the x-axis.;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow \left( 0,0 \right)\to \left( a,0 \right) \\ ; & A\left( a,0 \right)\to A\left( 2a,0 \right) \\ ; & B\left( 2a,0 \right)\to B\left( 3a,0 \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;; img;;(ii) Sketch y = f(-x);= y = f(x) is reflected in the y-axis.;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow A\left( a,0 \right)\to A\left( -a,0 \right) \\ ; & B\left( 2a,0 \right)\to B\left( -2a,0 \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;; img;;(iii) Sketch y = |f(x);= parts of y = f(x) below the x-axis reflected in the x-axis;; img

Assume that the line intersect;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow -2i+j+9k+s\left( 2i+5j+4k \right) \\ ; & =11i+8j+3k+t\left( 3i-j+5k \right);s,t\in R \\ ; & \Rightarrow -2+2s=11+3t-----(1) \\ ; & 1+5s=8-t---------(2) \\ ; & 9+4s=3+5t--------(3) \\ ; &  \\ ; & Eqn(1)+\left( 2 \right)\times 3:1+17s=35\Rightarrow s=2 \\ ; & Eqn\left( 2 \right):1+5\left( 2 \right)=8-t\Rightarrow t=-3 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Subst into eqn(3):;$$\begin{align};  & LHS=9+4\left( 2 \right)=17 \\ ; & RHS=3+5\left( -3 \right)=-12;e LHS \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Deduce that no value of s and t satisfies all equations simultaneously.;The lines do not intersect.;Since $$\left| \left( 2i+5j+4k \right).\left( 3i-j+5k \right) \right|;e \left| 2i+5j+4k \right|\left| 3i-j+5k \right|$$;i.e. the direction vectors of the lines are not parallel, the lines are skew.

Let $$f\left( x \right)={{x}^{3}}$$;Let $$\delta x$$= small change in x;By definition,;\[\begin{align};  & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ f\left( x \right) \right] \\ ; & =\underset{\delta x\to 0}{\mathop{\lim }}\,\frac{f\left( x+\delta x \right)-f\left( x \right)}{\delta x} \\ ; & =\underset{\delta x\to 0}{\mathop{\lim }}\,\frac{{{\left( x+\delta x \right)}^{3}}-{{x}^{3}}}{\delta x} \\ ; & =\underset{\delta x\to 0}{\mathop{\lim }}\,\frac{{{x}^{3}}+3{{x}^{2}}\delta x+3x{{\left( \delta x \right)}^{2}}+{{\left( \delta x \right)}^{3}}-{{x}^{3}}}{\delta x} \\ ; & =\underset{\delta x\to 0}{\mathop{\lim }}\,\frac{3{{x}^{2}}\delta x+3x{{\left( \delta x \right)}^{2}}+{{\left( \delta x \right)}^{3}}}{\delta x} \\ ; & =\underset{\delta x\to 0}{\mathop{\lim }}\,\left[ 3{{x}^{2}}+3x\delta x+{{\left( \delta x \right)}^{2}} \right]=3{{x}^{2}} \\ ;\end{align}\];

With $$u=2x-1\equiv x=\frac{1}{2}\left( u+1 \right),dx=\frac{1}{2}du$$;At $$x=1,u=1$$, at $$x=3,u=5$$;$$\begin{align};  & \int_{1}^{3}{\frac{x}{{{\left( 2x-1 \right)}^{3}}}dx} \\ ; & \equiv \int_{1}^{5}{\frac{\frac{1}{2}\left( u+1 \right)}{{{u}^{3}}}du} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{4}\int_{1}^{5}{\left( \frac{1}{{{u}^{2}}}+\frac{1}{{{u}^{3}}} \right)du} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{4}\left[ -\frac{1}{u}-\frac{1}{2{{u}^{2}}} \right]_{1}^{5} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{4}\left[ \left( -\frac{1}{5}-\frac{1}{50} \right)-\left( -1-\frac{1}{2} \right) \right]=\frac{8}{25} \\ ;\end{align}$$;

(i);$$\begin{align};  & y=\ln \left( 1+\tan x \right)\equiv {{e}^{y}}=1+\tan x \\ ; & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{e}^{y}} \right]=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ 1+\tan x \right] \\ ; && {{e}^{y}}\frac{dy}{dx}={{\sec }^{2}}x------(1) \\ ; & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{e}^{y}}\frac{dy}{dx} \right]=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{\sec }^{2}}x \right] \\ ; & {{e}^{y}}\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+{{e}^{y}}{{\left( \frac{dy}{dx} \right)}^{2}}=2{{\sec }^{2}}x\tan x--(2) \\ ;\end{align}$$;When x = 0,;$$y=\ln \left( 1+\tan 0 \right)=0$$;$$\begin{align};  & Eqn(1):{{e}^{0}}\frac{dy}{dx}={{\sec }^{2}}0\Rightarrow \frac{dy}{dx}=1 \\ ; & Eqn(2):{{e}^{0}}\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+{{e}^{0}}\left( 1 \right)=2{{\sec }^{2}}0\tan 0 \\ ; & \frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+1=0 \\ ; & \therefore \frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}=-1 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii) Let $$y=f\left( x \right)=\ln \left( 1+\tan x \right)$$;Maclaurin's series for $$y = f(x)$$ is;$$\begin{align};  & y=f\left( 0 \right)+f'\left( 0 \right)x+\frac{f''\left( 0 \right)}{2!}{{x}^{2}}+... \\ ; & =0+\left( 1 \right)x+\left( \frac{-1}{2} \right){{x}^{2}}+... \\ ; & =x-\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{2}}+... \\ ;\end{align}$$;

Given:;\[\begin{align};  & A+B={{120}^{\circ}}--------(1) \\ ; & \cos A+\cos B=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}-----(2) \\ ; & Eqn(2) \\ ; & \Rightarrow 2\cos \left( \frac{A+B}{2} \right)\cos \left( \frac{A-B}{2} \right)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \\ ; & 2\cos \left( \frac{{{120}^{0}}}{2} \right)\cos \left( \frac{A-B}{2} \right)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \\ ; & 2\left( \frac{1}{2} \right)\cos \left( \frac{A-B}{2} \right)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \\ ; & \therefore \cos \left( \frac{A-B}{2} \right)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \\ ;\end{align}\];;\[\begin{align};  & \cos \left( \frac{A-B}{2} \right)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \\ ; & \Rightarrow \frac{A-B}{2}=\pm {{45}^{\circ}} \\ ; & A-B=\pm {{90}^{\circ}}-----(3) \\ ; & Eqn(1)+(3): \\ ; & 2A={{120}^{\circ}}\pm {{90}^{\circ}} \\ ; & A={{60}^{\circ}}\pm {{45}^{\circ}} \\ ; & \therefore A={{15}^{\circ}},B={{105}^{\circ}} \\ ; & or \\ ; & A={{105}^{\circ}},B={{15}^{\circ}} \\ ;\end{align}\]

For the number to be odd, the last digit has 5 choices (1, 3, 5, 7, 9);No number is allowed to start with 0, the 1st digit has 8 choices (1 to 9 excluding one odd digit).;No. of ways to arrange remaining 8 digits = 8!;;Total no. of such 10-digit numbers = $$5\times 8\times 8!=1612800$$

Volume formed when R is rotated about the x-axis:;$$\begin{align};  & V=\int_{1}^{3}{\pi {{y}^{2}}dx} \\ ; & =\pi \int_{1}^{3}{{{\left[ {{\left( {{x}^{3}}+1 \right)}^{\frac{1}{4}}} \right]}^{2}}dx}=\pi \int_{1}^{3}{{{\left( {{x}^{3}}+1 \right)}^{\frac{1}{2}}}dx} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Let $$y=f\left( x \right)=\left( {{x}^{3}}+1 \right)\frac{1}{4}$$;Trapezium rule:;$$\int\limits_{a}^{b}{ydx}\approx \frac{1}{2}h\left[ {{y}_{0}}+{{y}_{n}}+2\left( {{y}_{1}}+{{y}_{2}}+...+{{y}_{n-1}} \right) \right]$$;where h = width of each trapezium, and yi is the value of y at x = a+ih.;With b = 3, a = 1 and n = 4 and $$h=\frac{b-a}{n}=\frac{3-1}{4}=0.5$$;\[\begin{align};  & {{y}_{0}}={{\left[ {{\left( 1.0 \right)}^{3}}+1 \right]}^{\frac{1}{2}}}=1.4142 \\ ; & {{y}_{1}}={{\left[ {{\left( 1.5 \right)}^{3}}+1 \right]}^{\frac{1}{2}}}=2.0916 \\ ; & {{y}_{2}}={{\left[ {{\left( 2.0 \right)}^{3}}+1 \right]}^{\frac{1}{2}}}=3.0000 \\ ; & {{y}_{3}}={{\left[ {{\left( 2.5 \right)}^{3}}+1 \right]}^{\frac{1}{2}}}=4.0773 \\ ; & {{y}_{4}}={{\left[ {{\left( 3.0 \right)}^{3}}+1 \right]}^{\frac{1}{2}}}=5.2915 \\ ; &  \\ ; & \therefore \pi \int_{1}^{3}{{{\left( {{x}^{3}}+1 \right)}^{\frac{1}{2}}}dx} \\ ; & \approx \pi \frac{1}{2}h\left[ {{y}_{0}}+{{y}_{4}}+2\left( {{y}_{1}}+{{y}_{2}}+{{y}_{3}} \right) \right] \\ ; & =\pi \frac{1}{2}\left( 0.5 \right)\left[ 1.4142+5.2915+2\left( 2.0916+3.0000+4.0773 \right) \right] \\ ; & =19.669=19.67 \\ ;\end{align}\];

(i);$$\begin{align};  & \int{{{\cos }^{2}}3xdx} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}\int{\left( 1+\cos 6x \right)dx} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}\left( x+\frac{1}{6}\sin 6x \right)+c \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}x+\frac{1}{12}\sin 6x+c \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii);$$\begin{align};  & \int{{{\tan }^{2}}2xdx} \\ ; & =\int{\left( {{\sec }^{2}}2x-1 \right)dx} \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}\tan 2x-x+c \\ ;\end{align}$$;

(i);$$\begin{align};  & {{\tan }^{-1}}x+{{\tan }^{-1}}y+{{\tan }^{-1}}\left( xy \right)=\frac{7}{12}\pi  \\ ; & Where \\ ; & x=1, \\ ; & {{\tan }^{-1}}\left( 1 \right)+{{\tan }^{-1}}y+{{\tan }^{-1}}\left[ \left( 1 \right)y \right]=\frac{7}{12}\pi  \\ ; & \frac{1}{4}\pi +2{{\tan }^{-1}}y=\frac{7}{12}\pi  \\ ; & 2{{\tan }^{-1}}y=\frac{7}{12}\pi -\frac{1}{4}\pi =\frac{1}{3}\pi  \\ ; & {{\tan }^{-1}}y=\frac{1}{6}\pi  \\ ; & \therefore y=\tan \frac{1}{6}\pi =\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii);$$\frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{\tan }^{-1}}\left( xy \right) \right]=\frac{1}{{{\left( xy \right)}^{2}}+1}\left( x\frac{dy}{dx}+y \right)$$;;(iii);$$\begin{align};  & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{\tan }^{-1}}x+{{\tan }^{-1}}y+{{\tan }^{-1}}\left( xy \right) \right]=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ \frac{7}{12}\pi  \right] \\ ; & \frac{1}{{{x}^{2}}+1}+\frac{1}{{{y}^{2}}+1}\frac{dy}{dx}+\frac{1}{{{\left( xy \right)}^{2}}+1}\left( x\frac{dy}{dx}+y \right)=0 \\ ; & \frac{1}{{{x}^{2}}+1}+\left[ \frac{1}{{{y}^{2}}+1}+\frac{x}{{{\left( xy \right)}^{2}}+1} \right]\frac{dy}{dx}+\frac{y}{{{\left( xy \right)}^{2}}+1}=0 \\ ; & When:x=1,y=\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \\ ; & \Rightarrow \frac{1}{\left( 1 \right)+1}+\left[ \frac{1}{\left( \frac{1}{3} \right)+1}+\frac{\left( 1 \right)}{\left( \frac{1}{3} \right)+1} \right]\frac{dy}{dx}+\frac{\left( \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \right)}{\left( \frac{1}{3} \right)+1}=0 \\ ; & \frac{1}{2}+\frac{3}{2}\frac{dy}{dx}+\frac{3}{4\sqrt{3}}=0 \\ ; & \frac{3}{2}\frac{dy}{dx}=-\frac{1}{2}-\frac{3}{4\sqrt{3}} \\ ; & \therefore \frac{dy}{dx}=-\frac{1}{3}-\frac{1}{2\sqrt{3}} \\ ;\end{align}$$

(i);$$\begin{align};  & \cos 3\theta =\cos \left( 2\theta +\theta  \right) \\ ; & =\cos 2\theta \cos \theta -\sin 2\theta \sin \theta  \\ ; & =\left( 2{{\cos }^{2}}\theta -1 \right)\cos \theta -\left( 2\sin \theta \cos \theta  \right)\sin \theta  \\ ; & =2{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -\cos \theta -2{{\sin }^{2}}\theta \cos \theta  \\ ; & =2{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -\cos \theta -2\left( 1-{{\cos }^{2}}\theta  \right)\cos \theta  \\ ; & =2{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -\cos \theta -2\cos \theta +2{{\cos }^{3}}\theta  \\ ; & =4{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -3\cos \theta  \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii) With $$x=6\cos \theta $$;$$\begin{align};  & {{x}^{3}}-27x+18=0 \\ ; & \equiv {{\left( 6\cos \theta  \right)}^{3}}-27\left( 6\cos \theta  \right)+18=0 \\ ; & =216{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -162\cos \theta =-18 \\ ; & =54\left( 4{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -3\cos \theta  \right)=-18 \\ ; & =54\cos 3\theta =-18 \\ ; & \cos 3\theta =-\frac{1}{3} \\ ; & 3\theta =1.9106,2\pi -1.9106,2\pi +1.9106 \\ ; & \theta =0.6369,1.4575,2.7313 \\ ; & \therefore x=6\cos \theta  \\ ; & =4.824,0.6783,-5.502 \\ ; & =4.82,0.678,-5.50 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(iii) Let the substitution be $$x=a\cos \theta $$;$$\begin{align};  & {{x}^{3}}-12x-2=0 \\ ; & \equiv {{a}^{3}}{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -12a\cos \theta -2=0 \\ ;\end{align}$$;For the substitution to be useful;$$\begin{align};  & {{a}^{3}}{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -12a\cos \theta \equiv 4{{\cos }^{3}}\theta -3\cos \theta  \\ ; & \Rightarrow \frac{{{a}^{3}}}{12a}=\frac{4}{3}\Rightarrow a=\pm 4 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;A suitable substitution is $$x=4\cos \theta $$;

(i) $$\frac{{{x}^{2}}}{9-{{x}^{2}}}\equiv A+\frac{B}{3-x}+\frac{C}{3+x}$$;By long division,;$$\begin{align};  & \frac{{{x}^{2}}}{9-{{x}^{2}}}=-1+\frac{9}{9-{{x}^{2}}}\Rightarrow A=-1 \\ ; & \therefore \frac{9}{9-{{x}^{2}}}\equiv \frac{9}{\left( 3-x \right)\left( 3+x \right)}\equiv \frac{B}{3-x}+\frac{C}{3+x} \\ ;\end{align}$$;Cover-up rule:;$$\begin{align};  & x=3:B=\frac{9}{3+3}=\frac{3}{2} \\ ; & x=-3:C=\frac{9}{3-\left( -3 \right)}=\frac{3}{2} \\ ; & \therefore \frac{{{x}^{2}}}{9-{{x}^{2}}}\equiv -1+\frac{3}{2\left( 3-x \right)}+\frac{3}{2\left( 3+x \right)} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii);$$\begin{align};  & \int_{0}^{2}{\frac{{{x}^{2}}}{9-{{x}^{2}}}dx} \\ ; & =\int_{0}^{2}{\left( -1+\frac{9}{{{3}^{2}}-{{x}^{2}}} \right)dx} \\ ; & =\left[ -x+\frac{9}{2\left( 3 \right)}\ln \left( \frac{3+x}{3-x} \right) \right]_{0}^{2} \\ ; & =\left[ \left( -2+\frac{3}{2}\ln 5 \right)-\left( 0+\frac{3}{2}\ln 1 \right) \right] \\ ; & =\frac{3}{2}\ln 5-2 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(iii);$$\begin{align};  & \int_{0}^{2}{\ln \left( 9-{{x}^{2}} \right)dx} \\ ; & =\left[ \ln \left( 9-{{x}^{2}} \right)\left( x \right) \right]_{0}^{2}-\int_{0}^{2}{x\frac{\left( -2x \right)}{9-{{x}^{2}}}dx} \\ ; & =\left[ \ln \left( 9-{{2}^{2}} \right)\left( 2 \right)-0 \right]+2\int_{0}^{2}{\frac{{{x}^{2}}}{9-{{x}^{2}}}dx} \\ ; & =2\ln 5+2\left( \frac{3}{2}\ln 5-2 \right)=5\ln 5-4 \\ ;\end{align}$$;

(i) Sketch cube:;img;Angle which EC makes with face CDHG is $$\angle ECH$$;$$\begin{align};  & \vartriangle CDH: \\ ; & C{{H}^{2}}=C{{D}^{2}}+D{{H}^{2}}={{1}^{2}}+{{1}^{2}}=2 \\ ; & \Rightarrow CD=\sqrt{2} \\ ; & \tan \angle ECH=\frac{EH}{CH}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \\ ; & \therefore \angle ECH={{35.26}^{\circ}}={{35.3}^{\circ}} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii) Deduce that FX = HX;$$\begin{align};  & \tan \angle ECH=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\Rightarrow \sin \angle ECH=\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \\ ; & \vartriangle CHX: \\ ; & HX=CH\sin \angle ECH=\sqrt{2}\left( \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \right)=\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}} \\ ; & \therefore FX=\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(iii) Angle between the planes the CEF and CEH is $$\angle FXH$$;Deduce that  $$FH\equiv CH=\sqrt{2}$$;Cosine rule on $$\vartriangle FXH$$:;$$\begin{align};  & F{{H}^{2}}=F{{X}^{2}}+H{{X}^{2}}-2FX.HX.\cos \angle FXH \\ ; & {{\left( \sqrt{2} \right)}^{2}}={{\left( \sqrt{\frac{2}{3}} \right)}^{2}}+{{\left( \sqrt{\frac{2}{3}} \right)}^{2}}-2\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}}\sqrt{\frac{2}{3}}\cos \angle FXH \\ ; & \cos FXH=-\frac{1}{2} \\ ; & \therefore \angle FXH={{120}^{\circ}} \\ ;\end{align}$$

a);\[\begin{align};  & {{x}^{2}}-9\ge \left( x+3 \right)\left( {{x}^{2}}-3x+1 \right) \\ ; & \left( x+3 \right)\left( x-3 \right)\ge \left( x+3 \right)\left( {{x}^{2}}-3x+1 \right) \\ ; & \left( x+3 \right)\left( {{x}^{2}}-3x+1 \right)-\left( x+3 \right)\left( x-3 \right)\le 0 \\ ; & \left( x+3 \right)\left[ \left( {{x}^{2}}-3x+1 \right)-\left( x-3 \right) \right]\le 0 \\ ; & \left( x+3 \right)\left( {{x}^{2}}-4x+4 \right)\le 0 \\ ; & \left( x+3 \right){{\left( x-2 \right)}^{2}}\le 0 \\ ; &  \\ ; & \left( x+3 \right){{\left( x-2 \right)}^{2}}=0 \\ ; & \Rightarrow x=-3 \\ ; & or \\ ; & x=2 \\ ;\end{align}\];;\[\left( x+3 \right){{\left( x-2 \right)}^{2}}<0\] \[\Rightarrow \left( x+3 \right)<0\] since $${{\left( x-2 \right)}^{2}}\ge 0$$ for $$x\in R$$;Solution is $$x\le -3$$ or x = 2;;b);(i);$$\begin{align};  & \frac{1-{{x}^{2}}}{\sqrt[3]{1+3x}}=\left( 1-{{x}^{2}} \right){{\left( 1+3x \right)}^{-\frac{1}{3}}} \\ ; & =\left( 1-{{x}^{2}} \right)\left[ 1+\left( -\frac{1}{3} \right)\left( 3x \right)+\frac{\left( -\frac{1}{3} \right)\left( -\frac{1}{3}-1 \right)}{2!}{{\left( 3x \right)}^{2}}+\frac{\left( -\frac{1}{3} \right)\left( -\frac{1}{3}-1 \right)\left( -\frac{1}{3}-2 \right)}{3!}{{\left( 3x \right)}^{3}}+... \right] \\ ; & =\left( 1-{{x}^{2}} \right)\left( 1-x+2{{x}^{2}}-\frac{14}{3}{{x}^{3}}+... \right) \\ ; & =\left( 1-x+2{{x}^{2}}-\frac{14}{3}{{x}^{3}}+... \right)-\left( {{x}^{2}}-{{x}^{3}}+... \right) \\ ; & =1-x+{{x}^{2}}-\frac{11}{3}{{x}^{3}}+... \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii) The expansion is valid for $$\left| 3x \right|<1\equiv \left| x \right|<\frac{1}{3}$$;;(iii) For any curve $$y={{a}_{0}}+{{a}_{1}}x+{{a}_{2}}{{x}^{2}}+{{a}_{3}}{{x}^{3}}+...$$ (a polynomial), at the point where x = 0, equation of tangent is $$y={{a}_{0}}+{{a}_{1}}x$$;For the curve,;$$y=\frac{1-{{x}^{2}}}{\sqrt[3]{1+3x}}\equiv 1-x+{{x}^{2}}-\frac{11}{3}{{x}^{3}}+...$$;at the point (0,1), equation of tangent is y=1-x;

(i) $${{x}^{2}}+{{y}^{2}}={{r}^{2}}\equiv {{y}^{2}}={{r}^{2}}-{{x}^{2}}$$;Deduce that shaded region is area under curve from $$x=r\cos \alpha $$ to x = r;Volume generated by rotating shaded region about the x-axis,;$$\begin{align};  & {{V}_{x}}=\int_{r\cos \alpha }^{r}{\pi {{y}^{2}}dx}=\pi \int_{r\cos \alpha }^{r}{{{\left( {{r}^{2}}-{{x}^{2}} \right)}^{2}}dx} \\ ; & =\pi \left[ {{r}^{2}}x-\frac{1}{3}{{x}^{3}} \right]_{r\cos \alpha }^{r} \\ ; & =\pi \left[ \left( {{r}^{3}}-\frac{1}{3}{{r}^{3}} \right)-\left( {{r}^{3}}\cos \alpha -\frac{1}{3}{{r}^{3}}{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha  \right) \right] \\ ; & =\pi \left( \frac{2}{3}{{r}^{3}}-{{r}^{3}}\cos \alpha +\frac{1}{3}{{r}^{3}}{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha  \right) \\ ; & =\frac{1}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}\left( {{\cos }^{3}}\alpha -3\cos \alpha +2 \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii) Total volume of S = volume of cylinder formed by rotating region bounded by ABCD about x-axis + 2 x Volume calculated in (i);$$\begin{align};  & =\pi {{\left( r\sin \alpha  \right)}^{2}}\left( 2r\cos \alpha  \right)+2\times \frac{1}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}\left( {{\cos }^{3}}\alpha -3\cos \alpha +2 \right) \\ ; & =2\pi r\left( 1-{{\cos }^{2}}\alpha  \right)\cos \alpha +\frac{2}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}\left( {{\cos }^{3}}\alpha -3\cos \alpha +2 \right) \\ ; & =2\pi {{r}^{3}}\cos \alpha -2\pi {{r}^{3}}{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha +\frac{2}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha -2\pi {{r}^{3}}\cos \alpha +\frac{4}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}} \\ ; & =\frac{4}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}-\frac{4}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha  \\ ; & =\frac{4}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}\left( 1-{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha  \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(iii) Volume of S = $$\frac{1}{2}\times $$Volume of sphere;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow \frac{4}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}}\left( 1-{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha  \right)=\frac{1}{2}\times \frac{4}{3}\pi {{r}^{3}} \\ ; & 1-{{\cos }^{3}}\alpha =\frac{1}{2} \\ ; & {{\cos }^{3}}\alpha =\frac{1}{2} \\ ; & \cos \alpha =\frac{1}{\sqrt[3]{2}} \\ ; & \therefore \alpha = 37.5^{\circ} \\ ;\end{align}$$;

a);Angle between $$\left( -i+3j+\lambda k \right)$$ and $$\left( 2i+2j+k \right)$$ is $${{\cos }^{-1}}\left( \frac{1}{3} \right)$$;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow \frac{\left( -i+3j+\lambda k \right)\left( 2i+2j+k \right)}{\left| -i+3j+\lambda k \right|\left| 2i+2j+k \right|}=\frac{1}{3} \\ ; & \frac{-2+6+\lambda }{\sqrt{{{1}^{2}}+{{3}^{2}}+{{\lambda }^{2}}}\sqrt{{{2}^{2}}+{{2}^{2}}+{{1}^{2}}}}=\frac{1}{3} \\ ; & \frac{\lambda +4}{\sqrt{10+{{\lambda }^{2}}}\sqrt{9}}=\frac{1}{3} \\ ; & \lambda +4=\frac{1}{3}\sqrt{10+{{\lambda }^{2}}}\sqrt{9}=\sqrt{10+{{\lambda }^{2}}} \\ ; & {{\left( \lambda +4 \right)}^{2}}=10+{{\lambda }^{2}} \\ ; & {{\lambda }^{2}}+8\lambda +16=10+{{\lambda }^{2}} \\ ; & 8\lambda =-6 \\ ; & \therefore \lambda =-\frac{3}{4} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;b);(i);$$\overrightarrow{OX}=\frac{1}{2}\left( \overrightarrow{OB}+\overrightarrow{OC} \right)=\frac{1}{2}b+\frac{1}{2}c$$;; img;;$$\begin{align};  & \overrightarrow{OG}=\frac{2}{3}\overrightarrow{OX}+\frac{1}{3}\overrightarrow{OA} \\ ; & =\frac{2}{3}\left( \frac{1}{2}b+\frac{1}{2}c \right)+\frac{1}{3}a \\ ; & =\frac{1}{3}a+\frac{1}{3}b+\frac{1}{3}c \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Deduce that G is the mid-point of face ABC.;Hence, AX, BY and CZ will go through G;;(ii);$$\begin{align};  & \overrightarrow{OL}=\frac{1}{2}\left( O+\overrightarrow{OA} \right)=\frac{1}{2}a \\ ; & \overrightarrow{OH}=\frac{1}{2}\left( \overrightarrow{OL}+\overrightarrow{OX} \right) \\ ; & =\frac{1}{2}\left( \frac{1}{2}a+\frac{1}{2}b+\frac{1}{2}c \right) \\ ; & =\frac{1}{4}a+\frac{1}{4}b+\frac{1}{4}c \\ ;\end{align}$$;; img;;Deduce that H is the centroid of OABC;Hence, LX, MY and NZ will pass through H, i.e. they are concurrent.

(a) Let n = no, of observations = 50;Let $${\mu}_{0}$$ = assumed mean = 22;Let $$\sigma$$ = Var(X) = 36;Test $${H}_{0}$$ : $${\mu}$$ =  $${\mu}_{0}$$ against $${H}_{1}$$ : $${\mu}$$ < $${\mu}_{0}$$ ;a 1-tailed test for less;;The 1% critical value, $${z}_{0.01} = 2.326$$;Reject $${H}_{0}$$ if $$z < -{z}_{0.01}$$;Under $${H}_{0}$$ , the test statistic is ;$$z = \frac{\overline{x} - {\mu}_{0}}{\sigma / \sqrt{n}} = \frac{20.2 - 22}{\sqrt{36 / 50}} = - 2.121$$;;Since $$z > - {z}_{0.01}$$, do not reject $${H}_{0}$$ and conclude that, at the 1% level of significance there is insufficient evidence that the mean $${\mu}$$ is less than 22.;;(b) Let p = proportion of the population who know the leader's name;Let $${n}_{1}$$ = sample size = 850;$$\hat{p} = \frac{124}{850} = \frac{62}{425}$$ ;$$\hat{q} = \frac{363}{425}$$ ;;$${z}_{0.025} \sqrt{\frac{\hat{p} \hat{q}}{{n}_{1}}} = 1.960\sqrt{\frac{( \frac{62}{425} ) ( \frac{363}{425} )}{850}} = 0.02373$$;;The 95% confidence interval for p is;$$[ \hat{p} - {z}_{0.025} \sqrt{\frac{\hat{p} \hat{q}}{{n}_{1}}} , \hat{p} + {z}_{0.025} \sqrt{\frac{\hat{p} \hat{q}}{{n}_{1}}} ]$$ ;$$ = [ \frac{62}{425} - 0.02373, \frac{62}{425}+ 0.02373 ]$$;$$ = [ 0.1222 , 0.1696 ]$$ ;$$ = [ 0.122, 0.170 ]$$ (ans);;Let $${n}_{2}$$ = sample size = 953;Let $${p}_{0}$$ = assumed p = 0.25;$$\hat{p} = \frac{263}{953}$$;Test $${H}_{0}$$ : $$p = {p}_{0}$$ against $${H}_{1}$$ : $$p > {p}_{0}$$;a 1-tailed test for more;The 5% critical value, $${z}_{0.05} = 1.645$$;Reject $${H}_{0}$$ if $$z > {z}_{0.05}$$;Under $${H}_{0}$$, the test statistic is ;$$z = \frac{\hat{p} - {p}_{0}}{\sqrt{{p}_{0}{q}_{0} / {n}_{2}}} = \frac{\frac{263}{953} - 0.25}{\sqrt{( 0.25 ) ( 0.75 ) / 953}} = 1.852$$;;Since $$z > {z}_{0.05}$$, reject $${H}_{0}$$ and conclude that, at the 5% level of significance, there is sufficient evidence that p > 0.25. (ans)

Let B = a black die taken;Let R= a red ball taken;Let G = a green ball taken;;The probability tree is displayed:;img;;Probability of event M is happening given that event W was happened,;$$P( M|W ) = \frac{P(M \cap W)}{P(W)} = \frac{ P( WRG ) + P( WGR )}{P(W)}$$;$$ = \frac{\frac{3}{28} + \frac{3}{28}}{\frac{2}{5}} = \frac{15}{28}$$  (ans);;(i) $$P( M \cap W ) = P( WRG ) + P( WGR )$$;$$=\frac{3}{28} + \frac{3}{28} = \frac{3}{14}$$ (ans);;(ii) $$P( W|M ) = \frac{P( W \cap M)}{P(M)} = \frac{ P( WRG ) + P( WGR )}{P( WRG )+ P ( WGR ) + P( BRG ) + P( BGR ) }$$;$$ = \frac{\frac{3}{28} + \frac{3}{28}}{\frac{3}{28} + \frac{3}{28} + \frac{6}{35} + \frac{6}{35}} = \frac{15}{13}$$  (ans);;(iii) $$P( W \cup M )$$;$$ = P( W ) + P( BRG ) + P( BGR )$$;$$ = \frac{2}{5} + \frac{6}{35} + \frac{6}{35} = \frac{26}{35}$$ (ans);;In the container there are 20 objects comprising 2 white dice, 3 black dice, 9 red balls, and 6 green balls.;There are $$4!$$ ways to select the 4 objects.;$$\therefore$$ P( one object of each colour taken);$$= 4! \times \frac{2}{20} \times \frac{3}{20} \times \frac{9}{20} \times \frac{6}{20} = \frac{243}{5000}$$ (ans)

(a)$$\frac{dy}{dx} = 2x + 2x{y}^{2} = 2x ( 1 + y^2 )$$;$$\int \frac{dy}{1 + y^2 } = \int 2xdx$$;$${\tan }^{-1} y = {x}^{2} + c$$, c = constant;$$\therefore y = \tan (x^2 + c)$$;When $$x = 0$$ , $$y = 1$$;$$\Rightarrow 1 = \tan ( 0 + c )$$   $$\Rightarrow c = \frac{1}{4}\pi$$;$$\therefore y = \tan (x^2 + \frac{1}{4}\pi )$$ (ans);;(b) $$( 1 + x^2 )\frac{dy}{dx} + 4xy = \frac{4x}{( 1 + x^2  )^3}$$;$$\equiv \frac{dy}{dx} + \frac{4x}{( 1 + x^2 )}y = \frac{4x}{( 1 + x^2  )^4}$$;Let $$h(x) = \int \frac{4x}{( 1 + x^2 )}dx$$;             $$= 2 ln( 1 + x^2 ) = ln( 1 + x^2 )^2$$;$$\Rightarrow$$ integrating factor;$${e}^{h(x)} = {e}^{ln( 1 + x^2 )^2} = ( 1 + x^2 )^2$$ and;$${e}^{-h(x)} = {e}^{-ln( 1 + x^2 )^2} = \frac{1}{( 1 + x^2 )^2}$$;;$$\therefore$$ General solution is;$$y = {e}^{-h(x)}\left[\int {e}^{hx} \frac{4x}{(1 + x^2)^4}dx + c\right]$$, c = constant;   $$= \frac{1}{( 1 + x^2 )^2}\left[\int ( 1 + x^2 )^2 \frac{4x}{(1 + x^2)^4}dx + c\right]$$;   $$= \frac{1}{( 1 + x^2 )^2}\left[\int \frac{4x}{(1 + x^2)^2}dx + c\right]$$;   $$= \frac{1}{( 1 + x^2 )^2}\left[ - \frac{2}{(1 + x^2)} + c\right] = \frac{c(1 + x^2) - 2}{(1 + x^2)^3}$$;When $$x = 0$$ , $$y = 1$$;$$\Rightarrow 1 =  \frac{c(1 + 0^2) - 2}{(1 + 0^2)^3}$$  $$\Rightarrow c = 3$$;$$\therefore y = \frac{3(1 + x^2) - 2}{(1 + x^2)^3} = \frac{3{x}^{2} + 1}{(1 + x^2)^3}$$ (ans)

(a) $$| wz | = | w | | z |$$;              $$ = ( \sqrt{2} )( 2 ) = 2 \sqrt{2}$$ (ans);$$arg( wz ) = arg(w) + arg(z)$$;               $$= ( -\frac{3}{4}\pi ) + ( -\frac{1}{3}\pi )$$;               $$= - \frac{13}{12}\pi \equiv \frac{11}{12}\pi $$ (ans);;$$w = \sqrt{2}\left[\cos ( - \frac{3}{4}\pi ) + i \sin ( - \frac{3}{4}\pi )\right]$$;$$= \sqrt{2}\left[ ( - \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}) + i ( - \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}})\right] = - 1 - i $$;;$$z = 2\left[\cos ( - \frac{1}{3}\pi ) + i \sin ( - \frac{1}{3}\pi )\right]$$;$$ = 2 \left[ ( \frac{1}{2}) + i ( - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} )\right] = 1 - \sqrt{3} i $$;;$$wz = ( - 1 - i )(1 - \sqrt{3} i )$$;$$ = ( - 1 - i + \sqrt{3}i - \sqrt{3})$$;$$ = ( - 1 - \sqrt{3}) + i ( \sqrt{3} - 1 )$$;;$$\therefore Re(wz) = - 1 - \sqrt{3}$$ (ans);                 $$Im(wz) = \sqrt{3} - 1$$ (ans);;Deduce that $$\sin (\frac{11}{12}\pi ) \equiv \sin ( \pi - \frac{11}{12}\pi ) \equiv \sin ( \frac{1}{12}\pi )$$;Equating imaginary parts of $$wz$$:;$$2\sqrt{2}\sin (\frac{11}{12}\pi ) =  \sqrt{3} - 1$$;$$\equiv 2\sqrt{2}\sin (\frac{1]}{12}\pi ) =  \sqrt{3} - 1$$;$$\therefore \sin (\frac{1}{12}\pi) = \frac{\sqrt{3}  - 1}{2\sqrt{2}}$$;;(b);(i) $$| z - 2i | = 4$$;$$\equiv$$ circle centred at (0,2), radius 4;;(ii)$$arg( z + 2 ) = \frac{1}{4}\pi $$;$$\equiv$$ half -line starting from ( - 2, 0) making an angle $$\frac{1}{4}\pi$$ with the Re-axis;;img;;Deduce from the sketch that the exact value of $$z$$ satisfying both (i) and (ii);$$= 4 \cos (\frac{1}{4}\pi) + i \left[ 2 + 4 \sin (\frac{1}{4}\pi)\right]$$;$$= 4 (\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}) + i \left[ 2 + 4 (\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}})\right]$$;$$= 2 \sqrt{2} + i \left[ 2 + 2\sqrt{2} \right]$$ (ans);;;

(i) $$\overrightarrow{AB} = \overrightarrow{OB} - \overrightarrow{OA}$$;                                    $$= ( - 4i + 4j - 2k ) - ( 5i + 4j +10k )$$;                                    $$= - 9i - 12k = - 3 ( 3i + 4k )$$;A vector equation of the line $$AB$$ is;$$r = \overrightarrow{OA} + t\overrightarrow{AB}$$;$$ = ( 5i + 4j +10k ) + t ( 3i + 4k )$$;$$\therefore$$ A cartesian equation of the line $$AB$$ is;$$\frac{x-5}{3} = \frac{z-10}{4}$$, $$y = 4$$ (ans);;(ii) Let $$\hat{n}$$ = unit vector parallel to $$\overrightarrow{AB}$$;$$= \frac{\overrightarrow{AB}}{|\overrightarrow{AB}|} = \frac{- 3 ( 3i + 4k )}{|- 3 ( 3i + 4k )|}$$;$$=\frac{- 3 ( 3i + 4k )}{3\sqrt{3^2 + 4^2}} = -\frac{3}{5}i - \frac{4}{5}k$$;$$\overrightarrow{AC} = \overrightarrow{OC} - \overrightarrow{OA}$$;$$=( - 5i + 9j + 5k ) - ( 5i + 4j + 10k )$$;$$=( - 10i + 5j - 5k )$$;;img;;Length of projection of $$\overrightarrow{AC}$$ onto $$AB$$,;$$p = |\overrightarrow{AC}.\hat{n}|$$;$$=|( - 10i + 5j - 5k ).(-\frac{3}{5}i - \frac{4}{5}k)| = | 6 + 0 + 4 |$$;$$= 10$$ units (ans);;(iii) Perpendicular distance from $$C$$ to $$AB$$,;$$d = \sqrt{|\overrightarrow{AC}|^{2}-p^2}$$;$$=\sqrt{(10^2 + 5^2 + 5^2) - 10^2} = 5\sqrt{2}$$ units (ans);;$$\overrightarrow{ON} = \overrightarrow{OA} + p\hat{n}$$;$$=( 5i + 4j + 10k ) + 10(-\frac{3}{5}i - \frac{4}{5}k)$$;$$= - i + 4j + 2k$$ (ans);;Ratio Theorem:;$$\overrightarrow{ON} = \frac{1}{2}(\overrightarrow{OC} + \overrightarrow{OD})$$;;(iv)$$\therefore \overrightarrow{OD} = 2\overrightarrow{ON} - \overrightarrow{OC}$$;$$ = 2( - i + 4j + 2k ) - ( - 5i + 9j +5k )$$;$$= 3i - j - k$$ (ans);

$$y={{e}^{x}}\Rightarrow \frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{e}^{x}} \right]={{e}^{x}}$$;At pt. where x = a, y = ea and $$\frac{dy}{dx}={{e}^{a}}$$;Equation of the tangent is given by:;$$\begin{align};  & y-{{e}^{a}}={{e}^{a}}\left( x-a \right) \\ ; & y={{e}^{a}}x+{{e}^{a}}\left( 1-a \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Tangent passes through the origin (0,0);$$\Rightarrow 0=0+{{e}^{a}}\left( 1-a \right)\Rightarrow a=1$$;Equation of tangent is $$y=ex$$;For line \[y=mx\] to intersect curve \[y=ex\] in 2 distinct points, \[m>e\];; img;

$$\begin{align};  & \frac{3{{x}^{2}}+23x+45}{x\left( x+3 \right)}\equiv \frac{3{{x}^{2}}+23x+45}{{{x}^{2}}+3x} \\ ; & =3+\frac{14x+45}{{{x}^{2}}+3x}\equiv 3+\frac{14x+45}{x\left( x+3 \right)} \\ ;\end{align}$$;Let $$\frac{14x+45}{x\left( x+3 \right)}=\frac{B}{x}+\frac{C}{x+3}$$;Cover up rule:;$$\begin{align};  & x=0:B=\frac{14\left( 0 \right)+45}{\left( 0 \right)+3}=15 \\ ; & x=-3:C=\frac{14\left( -3 \right)+45}{\left( -3 \right)}=-1 \\ ; & \therefore \frac{3{{x}^{2}}+23x+45}{x\left( x+3 \right)}\equiv 3+\frac{15}{x}-\frac{1}{x+3} \\ ;\end{align}$$

\[\overrightarrow{AB}=\overrightarrow{OB}-\overrightarrow{OA}=\left( i-j \right)-\left( 3i+2j \right)=-2i-3j\];Let $$\theta $$=acute angle between l and line through A and B;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow \left| \left( 2i-j \right)\left( -2i-3j \right) \right|=\left| 2i-j \right|\left| -2i-3j \right|\cos \theta  \\ ; & \left| -4+3 \right|=\sqrt{{{2}^{2}}+{{1}^{2}}}\sqrt{{{2}^{2}}+{{3}^{2}}}\cos \theta  \\ ; & \cos \theta =0.1240 \\ ; & \therefore \theta =82.88=82.9 \\ ;\end{align}$$

Sketch $$\vartriangle ABC$$ and $$\vartriangle PQR$$:;;img;;Cosine rule on $$\vartriangle PQR$$:;$$\begin{align};  & {{\left( a+k \right)}^{2}}={{\left( b+k \right)}^{2}}+{{\left( c+k \right)}^{2}}-2\left( b+k \right)\left( c+k \right)\cos P \\ ; & {{a}^{2}}+2ak+{{k}^{2}}={{b}^{2}}+2bk+{{k}^{2}}+{{c}^{2}}+2ck+{{k}^{2}}-2\left( b+k \right)\left( c+k \right)\cos P \\ ; & {{a}^{2}}-{{b}^{2}}-{{c}^{2}}+2\left( b+k \right)\left( c+k \right)\cos P=2bk+2ck-2ak+{{k}^{2}} \\ ;\end{align}$$;From $$\vartriangle ABC$$;$$\begin{align};  & {{a}^{2}}={{b}^{2}}+{{c}^{2}} \\ ; & \Rightarrow 2\left( b+k \right)\left( c+k \right)\cos P=2k\left( b+c-a \right)+{{k}^{2}} \\ ; & \therefore \cos P=\frac{2k\left( b+c-a \right)+{{k}^{2}}}{2\left( b+k \right)\left( c+k \right)} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;From $$\vartriangle ABC,b+c>a\Rightarrow \left( b+c-a \right)>0$$;Since k>0; $$\begin{align};  & \cos P=\frac{2k\left( b+c-a \right)+{{k}^{2}}}{2\left( b+k \right)\left( c+k \right)}>0 \\ ; &  \\ ;\end{align}$$;Hence P is acute

$$\begin{align};  & \frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{dy}{dt}/\frac{dx}{dt} \\ ; & =\frac{d}{dt}\left[ 60t-6{{t}^{2}} \right]/\frac{d}{dt}\left[ 120t-4{{t}^{2}} \right] \\ ; & =\frac{60-12t}{120-8t}=\frac{15-3t}{30-2t} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;Where the curve crosses the x-axis, y=0,;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow 60t-6{{t}^{2}}=0 \\ ; & 6t\left( 10-t \right)=0 \\ ; & t=0 \\ ; & or \\ ; & t=10 \\ ; & \frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{15-0}{30-0}=\frac{1}{2} \\ ; & or \\ ; & \frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{15-3\left( 10 \right)}{30-2\left( 10 \right)}=-\frac{3}{2} \\ ;\end{align}$$

No of ways to form committee of 3 men and 3 women;=no of ways to choose 3 of 7 men and 3 of 6 women,;=$$C_{3}^{7}\times C_{3}^{6}=700$$;;No of ways to form committee with both A and B included;=no of ways to choose remaining 2 of 6 men and 2 of 5 women,;$$=C_{2}^{6}\times C_{2}^{5}=150$$;No of ways to form committee, that include at most one of A and B;=700 - 150 = 550

$$\begin{align};  & \sec \theta \tan \theta =2 \\ ; & \Rightarrow \frac{1}{\cos \theta }\frac{\sin \theta }{\cos \theta }=2 \\ ; & \sin \theta =2{{\cos }^{2}}\theta \equiv 2\left( 1-{{\sin }^{2}}\theta  \right) \\ ; & 2{{\sin }^{2}}\theta +\sin \theta -2=0 \\ ; & \therefore \sin \theta =\frac{-1\pm \sqrt{{{1}^{2}}-4\left( 2 \right)\left( -2 \right)}}{2\left( 2 \right)} \\ ; & =\frac{-1-\sqrt{17}}{4}\left( <-1,NA \right) \\ ; & or \\ ; & \frac{\sqrt{17}-1}{4} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;$$\begin{align};  & \sec \theta \tan \theta =2 \\ ; & \equiv \sin \theta =\frac{\sqrt{17}-1}{4}=0.7808 \\ ; & \Rightarrow \theta =0.896 \space rad \\ ;\end{align}$$

For small x, $$\tan x\approx x,\sin x\approx x,\cos x\approx 1-\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{2}}$$;$$\begin{align};  & 25+7\tan x-24\cos x \\ ; & =25+7x-24\left( 1-\frac{1}{2}{{x}^{2}} \right) \\ ; & =1+7x+12{{x}^{2}} \\ ;\end{align}$$;;$$\begin{align};  & \frac{25+7\tan x-24\cos x}{1+\operatorname{s}\text{in3}x} \\ ; & \approx \frac{1+7x+12{{x}^{2}}}{1+3x} \\ ; & =\frac{\left( 1+3x \right)\left( 1+4x \right)}{1+3x}=1+4x \\ ;\end{align}$$;

(i);$$\begin{align};  & gf\left( x \right)=7 \\ ; & \equiv g\left( {{x}^{2}}+2x \right)=7 \\ ; & \equiv \left( {{x}^{2}}+2x \right)+4=7 \\ ; & \Rightarrow {{x}^{2}}+2x-3=0 \\ ; & \left( x+3 \right)\left( x-1 \right)=0 \\ ; & x=-3(NA,x\ge -1) \\ ; & or \\ ; & x=1 \\ ;\end{align}$$;;(ii) Let $$y={{f}^{-1}}\left( x \right)$$;$$\begin{align};  & \Rightarrow f\left( y \right)=x \\ ; & {{y}^{2}}+2y=x \\ ; & {{y}^{2}}+2y-x=0 \\ ; & y=\frac{-2\pm \sqrt{{{2}^{2}}-4\left( 1 \right)\left( -x \right)}}{2\left( 1 \right)} \\ ; & =-1-\sqrt{1+x}(NA,y\ge -1) \\ ; & or \\ ; & -1+\sqrt{1+x} \\ ; & \therefore {{f}^{-1}}:x\mapsto -1+\sqrt{1+x},x\ge -1 \\ ;\end{align}$$;

$$\begin{align};  & y=\tan \left( \frac{1}{2}{{\tan }^{-1}}x \right)\equiv {{\tan }^{-1}}y=\frac{1}{2}{{\tan }^{-1}}x \\ ; & \Rightarrow \frac{d}{dx}\left[ {{\tan }^{-1}}y \right]=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ \frac{1}{2}{{\tan }^{-1}}x \right] \\ ; & \frac{1}{1+{{y}^{2}}}\frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{1}{2}\frac{1}{1+{{x}^{2}}} \\ ; & \therefore \left( 1+{{x}^{2}} \right)\frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{1}{2}\left( 1+{{y}^{2}} \right) \\ ;\end{align}$$;;\[\begin{align};  & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ \left( 1+{{x}^{2}} \right)\frac{dy}{dx} \right]=\frac{d}{dx}\left[ \frac{1}{2}\left( 1+{{y}^{2}} \right) \right] \\ ; & \left( 1+{{x}^{2}} \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+2x\frac{dy}{dx}=y\frac{dy}{dx} \\ ; & \therefore \left( 1+{{x}^{2}} \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 2x-y \right)\frac{dy}{dx}=0 \\ ; &  \\ ; & \frac{d}{dx}\left[ \left( 1+{{x}^{2}} \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 2x-y \right)\frac{dy}{dx} \right]=0 \\ ; & \left( 1+{{x}^{2}} \right)\frac{{{d}^{3}}y}{d{{x}^{3}}}+2x\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 2x-y \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 2-\frac{dy}{dx} \right)\frac{dy}{dx}=0 \\ ; & \therefore \left( 1+{{x}^{2}} \right)\frac{{{d}^{3}}y}{d{{x}^{3}}}+\left( 4x-y \right)\frac{{{d}^{2}}y}{d{{x}^{2}}}+\left( 2-\frac{dy}{dx} \right)\frac{dy}{dx}=0 \\ ; &  \\ ;\end{align}\];

$$\sin 3\theta = \sin (2\theta + \theta)$$;$$= \sin 2\theta \cos \theta + \cos 2\theta \sin \theta$$;$$= 2\sin \theta \cos ^{2} \theta + (1 - 2\sin ^{2}\theta)\sin \theta$$;$$= 2\sin \theta(1 - \sin ^{2}\theta) + \sin \theta - 2\sin ^{3}\theta$$;$$=2\sin \ theta - 2\sin ^{3}\theta + \sin \theta - 2\sin ^{3}\theta$$;$$=3\sin \theta - 4\sin ^{3}\theta$$ (ans);;$$\sin 3\theta - \cos 2\theta$$;$$=(3 \sin \theta - 4\sin ^{3}\theta) - (1 - 2\sin ^{2}\theta)$$;$$=(3s - 4s^3) - ( 1 - 2s^2)$$;$$= - 1 + 3s + 2s^2 - 4s^3$$;$$=( 1 - s )(4s^2 + 2s - 1)$$ (ans);;With $$\theta = 18^0$$,;$$\sin 3\theta = \sin 3(18^0) = \sin 54^0 \equiv \cos (90^0 - 54^0)$$;$$=\cos 36^0 = cos2(18^0) \equiv \cos 2\theta$$;;$$\therefore \theta = 18^0$$ is an exact solution of $$\sin 3\theta  = \cos 2\theta$$. (ans);;(i);$$\sin 3\theta = \cos 2\theta \equiv \sin 3\theta - \cos 2\theta = 0$$;$$\equiv ( 1 - s )(4s^2 + 2s - 1) = 0$$;where $$s = \sin \theta$$ and $$\sin 18^0$$ is a solution.;$$\Rightarrow s = 1$$ (NA, $$\theta = 90^0$$);or $$s = \frac{-2 \pm \sqrt{2^2 - 4(4)(-1)}}{2(4)} = \frac{-2 \pm \sqrt{20}}{8}$$;$$=\frac{1}{4}(-1 -\sqrt{5})$$ (NA, $$\sin 18^0 > 0$$ );or $$\frac{1}{4}(-1 + \sqrt{5})$$;$$\therefore \sin 18^0 = \frac{1}{4}(-1 + \sqrt{5})$$ (ans);;(ii);With $$\theta = 234^0$$,;$$\sin 3\theta = \sin 3(234^0) = \sin 702^0$$;$$=\sin (720^0 - 18^0) \equiv \sin -18^0$$;$$\equiv \cos (360^0 + 90^0 + 18^0) = \cos 468^0$$;$$=\cos 2(234^0) \equiv \cos 2\theta$$;$$\therefore \theta = 234^0$$ is another exact solution of $$\sin 3\theta = \cos 2\theta$$.;Since $$\sin 234^0 < 0$$, deduce that ;$$\sin 234^0 = \frac{1}{4}(-1 -\sqrt{5})$$ (ans)

(a)$$\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}\frac{7\cos x - 4\sin x}{\cos x + \sin x}dx$$;$$\equiv \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}\frac{\frac{3}{2}(\cos x + \sin x) + \frac{11}{2}(\cos x - \sin x)}{\cos x + \sin x}dx$$;$$= \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}\left[\frac{3}{2} + \frac{11}{2}\frac{\cos x - \sin x}{\cos x + \sin x}\right]dx$$;$$=\left[\frac{3}{2}x + \frac{11}{2}\ln (\cos x + \sin x)\right]_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}$$ ;$$=\left[\frac{3}{2}(\frac{1}{2}\pi) + \frac{11}{2}\ln (0 + 1)\right] - \left[\frac{3}{2}(0) + \frac{11}{2}\ln  (1 + 0)\right]$$;$$=\frac{3}{4}\pi$$ (ans);;(b)$$\int_{1}^{e}(\ln x)^2dx$$;$$=\left[x(\ln x)^2\right]_{1}^{e} - \int_{1}^{e}\left[x.2(\ln x)\frac{1}{x}\right]dx$$;$$=\left[e(\ln e)^2 - (1)(\ln 1)^2\right] - 2\int_{1}^{e}left[\ln x]dx$$;$$=\left[e - 0\right] - 2\left[x.(\ln x)\right]_{1}^{e} - 2\int_{1}^{e}\left[x.\frac{1}{x}\right]dx$$;$$=e - 2(\left[e.(\ln e) - (1)(\ln 1)\right] - \int_{1}^{e}dx)$$;$$=e - 2(\left[e - 0\right] -\left[e - 1\right]) = e - 2$$ (ans);;(c) With $$x = \frac{1}{y} \equiv y = \frac{1}{x}$$ , $$dx = -\frac{1}{y^2}dy$$;$$\int \frac{1}{x\sqrt{ x^2  - 1}}dx$$;$$\equiv \int \frac{1}{\frac{1}{y}\sqrt{(\frac{1}{y})^2 - 1}}( -\frac{1}{y^2})dy$$;$$= - \int \frac{1}{\sqrt{1- y^2}}dy$$;$$= - \sin ^{-1}y + c$$, c = constant;$$= - \sin ^{-1}\frac{1}{x} + c$$ (ans)

Let $$O$$ = apex of pyramid;Let $$A$$,$$B$$,$$C$$,$$D$$ = corners of square base;Let $$P$$ = foot of perpendicular from O to base ABCD;Let $$M$$ = foot of perpendicular from O to edge AB;;img;;(i) Height of the pyramid is given by $$OP$$;$$OP = MP \tan \angle OMP = (\frac{1}{2}a)\tan 30^{\circ}$$;$$= (\frac{1}{2}a)(\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}) = \frac{a}{2\sqrt{ 3}}$$ (ans);;(ii) Length of sloping edge is given by $$OA$$.;$$\Delta OPM$$:;$$OM = MP / \cos \angle OMP = (\frac{1}{2}a)/\cos 30^{\circ}$$;$$= (\frac{1}{2}a)/(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}a$$;$$\Delta OAM$$:;$$OA = \sqrt{AM^2 + OM^2} = \sqrt{(\frac{1}{2}a)^2 + (\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}a)^2 }$$;$$= \sqrt{\frac{1}{4}a^2 + \frac{1}{3}a^2} = a\sqrt {\frac{7}{12}}$$ (ans);;(iii) Let $$N$$ = foot of perpendicular from $$B$$ to edge $$OC$$;Angle between two adjacent triangular faces is given by $$\angle BND$$.;;$$\sin \angle NCB \equiv \sin \angle OAM = \frac{OM}{OA} = \frac{\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}a}{\sqrt{\frac{7}{12}}a} = \sqrt{\frac{4}{7}}$$;$$BN = BC\sin \angle NCB = \sqrt{\frac{4}{7}}a$$;$$DN \equiv BN = \sqrt{\frac{4}{7}}a$$;;$$\Delta BCD$$: $$BD^2 = BC^2 + CD^2 = a^2 + a^2 = 2a^2$$;Cosine rule on $$\Delta BND$$:;$$BD^2 = BN^2 + DN^2 - 2.BN.DN.\cos \angle BND$$;$$2a^2 = \frac{4}{7}a^2 + \frac{4}{7}a^2 - 2(\sqrt{\frac{4}{7}}a)(\sqrt{\frac{4}{7}}a)\cos \angle BND$$;$$\cos \angle BND = - \frac{3}{4}$$;$$\angle BND = 138.6^{\circ} = 139^{\circ}$$ (ans)

(a) Let $$L$$ = length of cylinder = $$20x$$;When $$x = 5$$ , $$\frac{dx}{dt} = 0.025$$;;(i) Rate of increase of length of cylinder,;$$\frac{dL}{dt} = \frac{d}{dt}[20x] = 20\frac{dx}{dt}$$;$$= 20 (0.025) = 0.50 cms^{-1}$$;;(ii) Let $$V$$ = volume of cylinder = $$xL = 20x^2$$;Rate of increase of the volume of the cylinder,;$$\frac{dV}{dt} = \frac{d}{dt}[20x^2] = 40x\frac{dx}{dt}$$;$$= 40(5)(0.025) = 5.0 cm^{3}s^{-1}$$ (ans);;(iii) Let $$r$$ = radius of the cylinder = $$\sqrt{\frac{x}{\pi}}$$;Rate of increase of the radius of the cylinder,;$$\frac{dr}{dt} = \frac{d}{dt}[\sqrt{\frac{x}{\pi}}] = \frac{1}{2}\sqrt{\frac{1}{\pi x}}\frac{dx}{dt}$$;$$=\frac{1}{2}\sqrt{\frac{1}{\pi (5)}}(0.025) = 0.04954$$;$$= 0.0495 cms^{-1}$$ (ans);;(b);img;;Volume formed when $$R$$ is rotated about the $$x-axis$$, $${V}_{x}$$;$$=\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi}(\pi {y}_{2}^{2} - \pi {y}_{1}^{2})dx$$;$$=\pi \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi}(\cos ^{2}x - \sin ^{2}x)dx$$;$$=\pi \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi}\cos 2xdx$$;$$=\pi\left[\frac{1}{2}\sin 2x\right]_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi}$$;$$=\pi \left[\frac{1}{2} - 0\right] = \frac{1}{2}\pi$$ (ans);;

$$F( x ) = \int_{- \infty}^{x} f( t )d t = \int^x_0 \frac{1}{a}dt$$  for $$0 \leq t \leq a$$;$$= \frac{1}{a}x$$;;\[ F(x) = \left\{ ;  \begin{array}{l l};    0 & \quad x < 0\\;    \frac{1}{a}x & \quad 0 \leq x \leq a\\;    1 & \quad x > a;  \end{array} \right.\];;(i) $$L < x$$ if and only if $${X}_{1} < x$$ and $${X}_{2} < x$$;$${F}_{L}( x ) = P ( L < x ) \equiv P ( {X}_{1} < x ) \times P ( {X}_{2} < x )$$ ;$$ = \frac{1}{a}x \times \frac{1}{a}x$$ ;$$ = \frac{1}{a^2} x^2$$;;Cumulative distribution function of L,;\[ {F}_{L}(x) = \left\{ ;  \begin{array}{l l};    0 & \quad x < 0\\;    \frac{1}{a^2}x^2 & \quad 0 \leq x \leq a\\;    1 & \quad x > a;  \end{array} \right.\];;(ii) ;$${f}_{L}( x ) = \frac{d}{dx} [ {F}_{L}( x ) ] = \frac{d}{d x}[ \frac{1}{a^2} x^2 ]$$ ;$$ = \frac{2x}{a^2}$$;;$$\therefore$$ Probability density function of $$L$$,;\[ {f}_{L}(x) = \left\{ ;  \begin{array}{l l};    \frac{2x}{a^2} & \quad 0 \leq x \leq a\\;    0 & \quad \text{otherwise};  \end{array} \right.\];;(iii) ;$$E( L ) = \int^\infty_{-\infty} x{f}_{L}( x )dx$$ ;$$ = \int^a_0 x ( \frac{2}{a^2}x )dx  = \frac{2}{a^2}\int^a_0 x^2 dx$$ ;$$ = \frac{2}{a^2}{[ \frac{1}{3}x^3 ]}^a_0 = \frac{2}{a^2}[ \frac{1}{3}a^3 ] = \frac{2}{3}a$$ (ans);;$$E( L^2 ) =  \int^\infty_{-\infty} x^2{f}_{L}( x )dx$$ ;$$ = \int^a_0 x^2 ( \frac{2}{a^2}x )dx  = \frac{2}{a^2}  \int^a_0 x^3dx$$ ;$$ = \frac{2}{a^2}{[ \frac{1}{4}x^4 ]}^a_0 = \frac{2}{a^2}[ \frac{1}{4}a^4 ] = \frac{1}{2}a^2$$; ;$$ Var( L ) = E( L^2 )- [ E ( L ) ]^2$$ ;$$ = \frac{1}{2}a^2 - [ \frac{2}{3}a ]^2 = \frac{1}{18}a^2$$ (ans);;(iv) ;Let $$m$$ = median of $$L$$;$$\Rightarrow P( L \leq m ) = \frac{1}{2} \equiv F( m ) = \frac{1}{2}$$ ;$$\Rightarrow \frac{1}{a^2}m^2 = \frac{1}{2}$$;$$\therefore m = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}a$$ (ans)

Let $$n$$ = sample size = 8000;Let $${p}_{1}$$ = P(customer claim free offer) = 0.4;Let $${p}_{2}$$ = P(customer claim cheap offer) = 0.2;Let $${q}_{1} = 1 - {p}_{1} = 0.6$$ and $${q}_{2} = 1- {p}_{2} = 0.8$$;;Let X = no of customer out of n claiming free offers;Let Y = no of customers out of n claiming cheap offers;$$X \sim B(n,{p}_{1})$$ and $$Y \sim B(n,{p}_{2})$$;$$E(X) = n{p}_{1} = 8000(0.4) = 3200$$;$$E(Y) = n{p}_{2} = 8000(0.2) = 1600$$;;Since n (=8000) is large,;$$n{p}_{1} = 3200 > 5$$ and $$n{q}_{1} = 4800 > 5$$,;$$n{p}_{2} = 1600 > 5$$ and $$n{q}_{2} = 6400 > 5$$,;$$X \sim N(n{p}_{1}, n{p}_{1}{q}_{1}) $$ and ;$$Y \sim N(n{p}_{2}, n{p}_{2}{q}_{2}) $$ approximately;;Let $$T$$ = total cost to the company of the offers ;$$= 5X + 3Y$$;Let $$\mu = E(T) = E(5X + 3Y)$$;$$= 5E(X) + 3E(Y) = 5(3200) + 3(1600) = 20800$$;Expected total cost to company = E(T) = $20800 (ans);;Let $$\sigma^2 = Var ( T ) = Var ( 5X + 3Y )$$ ;$$ = 5^2 Var(X) + 3^2 Var(Y)$$;$$ = 25n{p}_{1}{q}_{1} + 9n{p}_{2}{q}_{2}$$ ;$$ = 25(8000)(0.4)(0.6) + 9(8000)(0.2)(0.8)$$ ;$$ = 59520$$;;$$T \sim N(\mu, \sigma^2)$$ approximately ;$$ P ( T > 20700 ) $$;$$= P(T > 20700.5) \leftarrow$$ continuity correction ;$$ \equiv P ( Z > \frac{20700.5 - \mu}{\sigma} )$$;$$ = P(Z > \frac{20700.5 - 20800}{\sqrt{59520}})$$ ;$$ = P ( Z > - 0.4078 ) \equiv \Phi ( 0.408 )$$ ;$$ = 0.6583 = 0.658$$ (ans);;Let $${p}_{3}$$ = P(customer claim special prize) = 0.0005;Let $$S$$ = no of customers out of n claiming special prizes;$$S \sim B(n,{p}_{3})$$;Since n (=8000) is large and $$n{p}_{3} = 4 < 5$$,;$$S \sim {P}_{0}(\lambda)$$ approximately, where $$\lambda = n{p}_{3} = 4$$;Cost of each special prize = $1000;$$\Rightarrow$$ P(cost of special prizes exceeds $4000);$$\equiv P ( S > 4 )$$;$$ = 1 - [ P(S = 0) + P(S = 1) + P(S = 2) + P ( S = 3 ) + P ( S = 4 )]$$  ;$$ = 1 - e^{- \lambda}[ \frac{\lambda^0}{0 !}+ \frac{\lambda^1}{1 !}+ \frac{\lambda^2}{2 !}+ \frac{\lambda^3}{3 !}+ \frac{\lambda^4}{4 !}] $$;$$ = 1 - e^{- 4} [ 1 + 4 + \frac{4^2}{2} + \frac{4^3}{3 !} + \frac{4^4}{4 !} ]$$;$$ = 0.3712 = 0.371$$ (ans)

Let $$n$$ = sample size = 90;Let $$\mu = E(x)$$;Let $$\sigma^2 = Var(x)$$;Let $$\mu_{0}$$ = assumed mean = 36.0 h;;$$\hat{\mu} = \overline{x} = \frac{\sum x}{n} = \frac{3040.8}{90} = 33.787$$ ;$$\hat{\sigma}^2 = \frac{1}{n - 1}[ \sum x^2 - \frac{1}{n}(\sum x)^2 ]$$ ;$$ = \frac{1}{89} [ 115773.66 - \frac{1}{90} ( 3040.8 )^2 ]$$ ;$$ = 146.46$$;;Test $${H}_{0}: \mu =\mu_{0}$$ against $${H}_{1}: \mu < \mu_0$$ a 1-tailed test for less;The 1% critical value, $${z}_{0.01} = 2.326$$;Reject $${H}_{0}$$ if $$z < -{z}_{0.01}$$;Under $${H}_{0}$$, the test statistic is ;;$$z = \frac{\overline{x} - \mu_0}{\sigma / \sqrt{n}} = \frac{33.787 - 36.0}{\sqrt{146.46 / 90}} = - 1.735$$;;Since $$ z > - {z}_{0.01}$$, do not reject {H}_{0} and conclude that, at the 1% level of significance, these is insufficient evidence that the mean 'standby time' is less than 36.0h. (ans);;Let $${n}_{1}$$ = sample size = 50;Let $$p$$ = population proportion of batteries with talk-time less than 5 h.;$$\hat{p} = \frac{6}{50} = \frac{3}{25}$$;$$\hat{q} = 1 - \hat{p} = \frac{22}{25}$$;$$z_{0.05} \sqrt{\frac{\hat{p} \hat{q}}{{n}_{1}}} = 1.645\sqrt{\frac{( \frac{3}{25} ) ( \frac{22}{25} )}{50}} = 0.0756$$;;The 90% confidence interval for p is;$$[\hat{p} - z_{0.05} \sqrt{\frac{\hat{p} \hat{q}}{{n}_{1}}} , \hat{p} + z_{0.05} \sqrt{\frac{\hat{p} \hat{q}}{{n}_{1}}} ]$$ ;$$ =  [\frac{3}{25}- 0.0756, \frac{3}{25}+ 0.0756 ]$$ ;$$ = [ 0.0444 , 0.1956 ]$$ ;$$ = [ 0.044, 0.196 ]$$ (ans);;Given test:;Test $${H}_{0}$$ : $$\mu = 5$$ against $${H}_{1}: \mu <  5$$ a 1-tailed test for less ;At 5% significance level, critical value, $${z}_{0.05} = 1.645$$;$${H}_{0}$$ is rejected $$\Rightarrow$$ test statistic $$ z < - {z}_{0.05}$$;;Statement (a) is (i) necessarily true, because at 10% significance level, critical value, $${z}_{0.10} = 1.282$$ ;Since $$ - {z}_{0.05} < - {z}_{0.10}$$,;$$ z < - {z}_{0.05} \Rightarrow z < - {z}_{0.10}$$ (ans);;Statement (b) is (iii) neither necessarily true nor necessarily false. ;Test $${H}_{0} : \mu = 5$$ against $${H}_{1} : \mu \neq 5$$ a 2 tailed test for difference ;At 5% significance level, critical value $${z}_{0.025} = 1.960$$;$${H}_{0}$$ is rejected if $$| z | > | {z}_{0.025} |$$;$$ z < {z}_{0.025}$$ does not necessarily imply $$| z | > | {z}_{0.025} |$$ (ans)

(a);(i) $$P(A \cup B) = 1 - P[(A \cup B)']$$;$$= 1- P(A' \cap B')$$;$$= 1 - \frac{1}{6} = \frac{5}{6}$$;;(ii) $$P( A \cap B) = P(B|A).P(A) = \frac{1}{4}.\frac{1}{3} = \frac{1}{12}$$;$$P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P( A \cap B)$$;$$\Rightarrow \frac{5}{6} = \frac{1}{3} + P(B) -\frac{1}{12}$$;$$\therefore P(B) = \frac{7}{12}$$ (ans);;(b) Let $$X$$ = letter to $$X$$ is in correct envelope;and $$X'$$ = letter to $$X$$ is in incorrect envelope;;(i) $$P(A \cap B') = \frac{1}{5} \times \frac{3}{4} = \frac{3}{20}$$ (ans);;(ii) $$P(A|B') = \frac{P(A \cap B')}{P(B')} = \frac{\frac{3}{20}}{\frac{4}{5}} = \frac{3}{16}$$ (ans);;(iii) $$P(A' \cap B')$$;$$ = P[(A \cup B)']$$;$$ = 1 - P(A \cup B)$$;$$ = 1 - [P(A) + P(B) - P(A \cap B)]$$;$$ = 1 - [\frac{1}{5} + \frac{1}{5} - \frac{1}{5} \times \frac{1}{4}] = \frac{13}{20}$$ (ans)

(a) $$(\frac{ 3 - i}{2 + i}) z = \frac{5 + 5i}{ - 1 + 2i}$$;$$z = \frac{5 + 5i}{ -1 + 2i} \cdot \frac{2 + i}{3 - i} = \frac{10 + 15i - 5}{-3 +7i + 2} + \frac{5 + 15i}{ -1 + 7i}$$;$$= \frac{5 + 15i}{ -1 + 7i} \cdot \frac{ -1 - 7i}{ -1 - 7i} = \frac{-5 -50i -105}{50}$$;$$= 2 - i$$ (ans);;(b)$$z^2  + 6z + 13 = 0$$;$$\Rightarrow z = \frac{ -6 \pm \sqrt{6^2 - 4(1)(13)}}{2(1)} = - 3 \pm 2i$$;$$\therefore {z}_{1} = - 3 + 2i$$ and $${z}_{2} = - 3 - 2i$$ (ans);;Sketch roots on Argand diagram:;img;;(i)$$| {z}_{1}  + 1 | = |( -3 + 2i) + 1 | = | - 2 + 2i |$$;$$ = \sqrt{2^2 + 2^2} = 2\sqrt{2}$$ (ans);$$arg({z}_{1}  + 1) = arg( - 2 + 2i ) = \tan (\frac{2}{-2})$$;$$ = \frac{3}{4}\pi$$ rad  (ans);;(ii) Deduce that;$$| {z}_{2}  + 1 | = | {z}_{1}  + 1 | = 2\sqrt{2}$$ (ans);$$arg({z}_{2}  + 1) = arg({z}_{1}  + 1) = \frac{3}{4}\pi$$ rad (ans);;Sketch $$| z + 1 | = 2\sqrt{2}$$;$$\equiv $$ circle centred at ( -1 , 0 ), radius $$2\sqrt{2}$$;Sketch $$arg ( z + 1 ) = \frac{1}{4}\pi$$;$$\equiv $$ half -line starting from ( -1 , 0 )making an angle $$\frac{1}{4}\pi$$ with the Re-axis;Deduce from the sketch that the complex number represented by intersection of the 2 loci is 1 + 2i (ans)

(a)$$x\frac{dy}{dx} + 3y = 5x^2   \equiv \frac{dy}{dx} + \frac{3}{x}y = 5x$$;Let $$h(x) = \int \frac{3}{x}dx = 3 \ln x$$;$$\Rightarrow$$ integrating factor,;$$e^{h(x)} = e^{3 \ln x} = x^{3}$$ and;$$e^{- h(x)} = e^{ - 3 \ln x} =  x^{-3}$$;$$\therefore$$ General Solution is;$$y = e^{- h(x)}[\int e^{h(x)} 5xdx + c]$$, c = constant;$$ = x^{-3}[\int (x^3)(5x)dx + c]$$;$$ = x^{-3}[\int 5x^4dx + c]$$;$$ = x^{-3}[ x^5 + c] = x^2 + cx^{-3}$$ (ans);;(b) Let $$a$$ = constant cross-section area of tank;Let $$v$$ = volume of water in tank = $$ax$$;$$\frac{d}{dt}[v] = $$ ( constant inflow ) - ( outflow $$\propto  x$$);$$\frac{d}{dt}[ax] = b - cx$$,   b , c = +ve constants;$$a\frac{dx}{dt} = b - cx$$;$$\frac{dx}{dt} = k - dx$$, $$k = b / a$$ and $$d = c / a$$;;When $$x = 0.5$$, $$\frac{dx}{dt} = 0$$;$$\Rightarrow k - d(0.5) = 0 \Rightarrow 2k = d$$;$$\therefore \frac{dx}{dt} = k - 2kx  \equiv  - k (2x - 1)$$ (ans);;When $$t = 0$$, $$x = 0.75$$ and $$\frac{dx}{dt} = - 0.01$$;$$\Rightarrow - 0.01 = - k [ 2(0.75) - 1]$$;$$\therefore k = 0.02$$;;$$\frac{dx}{dt} = - 0.02 ( 2x - 1 )$$;For $$x = 0.75$$ to $$x = 0.55$$,;$$\int_{0.75}^{0.55}\frac{1}{2x - 1}dx = - 0.02 \int_{0}^{t}dt$$;$$[\frac{1}{2} \ln (2x - 1)]_{0.75}^{0.55} = - 0.02t$$;$$\frac{1}{2} [\ln (0.1) - \ln (0.5)] = - 0.02t$$;$$ - 0.8047 = - 0.02t$$;$$\therefore t = 40.236 = 40.2 s$$ (ans)

(a)$$\overrightarrow{PQ} = \overrightarrow{OQ} - \overrightarrow{OP}$$;$$ = (9i - 7j - 2k) - (3i - j + k)$$;$$ = 6i - 6j -3k$$;$$\therefore PQ \equiv | \overrightarrow{PQ} | = \sqrt{6^2 + 6^2 + 3^2} = 9$$ units (ans);;Unit vector in the direction of $$\overrightarrow{PQ}$$.;$$ = \frac{\overrightarrow{PQ}}{|\overrightarrow{PQ}|} = \frac{1}{9}(6i - 6j -3k)$$;$$ = \frac{2}{3}i - \frac{2}{3}j - \frac{1}{3}k$$ (ans);;Line $$l$$ : $$\frac{x - 3}{ - 2} = \frac{y + 1}{1} = \frac{z - 1}{2}$$;$$\equiv (3i - j + k) + t( - 2i + j + 2k)$$, $$t \in \mathbb{R}$$;Let $$m$$ = direction vector of $$l = - 2i + j + 2k$$;;(i) Length of the projection of $$PQ$$ onto $$l$$,;$$p = \frac{|\overrightarrow{PQ}.m|}{|m|} = \frac{(6i - 6j -3k).(- 2i + j + 2k)}{|- 2i + j + 2k|}$$;$$ = \frac{| -12 - 6 - 6|}{\sqrt{2^2 + 1^2 + 2^2}} = 8$$ units (ans);;(ii) $$P$$ is on $$l$$;$$\Rightarrow$$ Length of perpendicular from $$Q$$ to $$l$$,;$$d = \sqrt{PQ^2 - p^2}$$;$$ = \sqrt{9^2 - 8^2}$$;$$ = \sqrt{17}$$ units (ans);;(b)$$(b - c) \cdot (b - c) = (b - c)\cdot b - (b - c)\cdot c$$;$$ = b.b - c.b - b.c + c.c$$;$$ = {| b |}^2 + {| c |}^2 - 2b.c$$ (ans);;$$b = \overrightarrow{AC}$$ and  $$c = \overrightarrow{AB}   \Rightarrow b - c = \overrightarrow{BC}$$;$$ {| b |}^2 + {| c |}^2 - (b - c) \cdot (b - c) = 2 b \cdot c$$;$$\equiv {| b |}^2 + {| c |}^2 - {| b - c |}^2 = 2 | b | | c | \cos \angle BAC$$;$$\equiv AC^2 + AB^2 - BC^2 = 2.AC.AB.\cos \angle BAC$$;$$\equiv BC^2 = AC^2 + AB^2 - 2.AC.AB.\cos \angle BAC$$;--- the cosine formula for triangle ABC.
