The probability tree showing the above information:;img;;Let S denote a successful shot(Hit) and F denote a unsuccessful shot(Miss);(i);The probability that all 3 shots were successful  $$\begin{align}= P(SSS) = \frac{1}{8} \times \frac{2}{8} \times \frac{4}{8} = \frac{1}{64} \end{align}$$;;(ii);The probability that at least 2 shots were successful;$$\begin{align} = P(SSS) + F(FSS) + P(SFS) + P(SSF);\\ = \frac{1}{64} + \left(\frac{7}{8} \times \frac{1}{8} \times \frac{2}{8}\right) + \left(\frac{1}{8} \times \frac{6}{8} \times \frac{2}{8}\right) + \left(\frac{1}{8} \times \frac{2}{8} \times \frac{4}{8}\right);\\ = \frac{1}{64} + \frac{14}{512} + \frac{12}{512} + \frac{8}{512};\\ = \frac{21}{256}\end{align}$$;;(iii);The probability that the $$3^{rd}$$ shot is successful given exactly 2 of the three shots are successful;$$\begin{align} = \frac{P(FSS) +P(SFS)}{P(FSS)+P(SFS)+P(SSF)};\\ = \frac{\frac{14}{512}+\frac{12}{512}}{\frac{14}{512}+\frac{12}{512}+\frac{8}{512}} ;\\ = \frac{26}{34} = \frac{13}{17}\end{align}$$

$$\therefore$$ To find equation of regression line of x on t:;Let n be the sample size = 9;$$ \sum x = 82+65+43+37+22+19+12+6+2 = 288 $$;$$ \sum x^2 = 82^2+65^2+43^2+37^2+22^2+19^2+12^2+6^2+2^2 = 15196 $$;$$ \sum t = 15+30+60+90+120+150+180+240+300=1185$$;$$ \sum t^2 = 15^2+30^2+60^2+90^2+120^2+150^2+180^2+240^2+300^2=229725$$;$$ \sum xt = (82)(15)+(65)(30)+(43)(60)+(37)(90)+(22)(120)+(19)(150)+(12)(180)+(6)(240)+(2)(300) = 18780 $$;;$$\begin{align} \overline{x} = \frac{\sum x}{n} = \frac{288}{9} = 32;\\ \overline{t} = \frac{\sum t}{n} = \frac{1185}{9} = 131.67\end{align}$$;;Regression coefficient of x and t:;$$\begin{align} \beta_x = \frac{\sum xt - \frac{\sum x \sum t}{n}}{\sum t^2 - \frac{(\sum t)^2}{n}} ;\\ = \frac{18780-\frac{288 x 1185}{9}}{229725 - \frac{1185^2}{9}};\\ = -0.2597\end{align}$$;;$$\therefore$$ Equation of the regression line of x on t:;$$\begin{align} x - \overline{x} = \beta_x(t-\overline{t});\\ \Rightarrow x - 32 = -0.2597(t-131.67);\\ \Rightarrow x = -0.2597t + 66.19;\\ \Rightarrow x = -0.260t + 66.2 (from \space GC) \end{align}$$;;$$\therefore$$ The corresponding estimated value of x when t = 300;$$ x_{300} = 66.1940-0.259701(300) = -11.72 = -11.7(3sf) $$;;$$\therefore$$ Comment on the suitability of the model:;This estimated value of x is impossible because the concentration of the drug in the bloodstream cannot be negative. Besides, the curved nature of the graph suggests that a straight line is not a good model.;;The variable y is defined by y = ln x;(i);For the variables y and t, ;$$\therefore$$ Let n be the sample size = 9;$$ \sum y = \ln 82 + \ln 65 + \ln 43 + \ln 37 + \ln 22 + \ln 19 + \ln 12 + \ln 6 + \ln 2 = ;26.959 $$;$$ \sum y^2 = (\ln 82)^2 + (\ln 65)^2 + (\ln 43)^2 + (\ln 37)^2 + (\ln 22)^2 + (\ln 19)^2 + (\ln 12)^2 + (\ln 6)^2 + (\ln 2)^2 = 92.120 $$;$$ \sum t = 15+30+60+90+120+150+180+240+300=1185$$;$$ \sum yt = (\ln 82)(15) + (\ln 65)(30) + (\ln 43)(60) + (\ln 37)(90) + (\ln 22)(120) + (\ln 19)(150) + (\ln 12)(180) + (\ln 6)(240) + (\ln 2)(300) = 2639.8 $$;;$$\therefore$$ The product moment correlation coefficient;$$\begin{align} r = \frac{\sum yt - \frac{\sum y \sum t}{n}}{\sqrt{\left(\sum t^2 - \frac{\left(\sum t\right)^2}{n}\right)\left(\sum y^2 - \frac{\left(\sum y\right)^2}{n}\right)}} \\ = \frac{2639.8 - \frac{26.959 \times 1185}{9}}{\sqrt{\left(229725- \frac{\left(1185\right)^2}{9}\right)\left(92.12 - \frac{\left(26.959\right)^2}{9}\right)}} ;\\ = -0.9941 = -0.994\end{align}$$;;$$\therefore$$ Comment on the value:;The product moment correlation coefficient of the linear model;$$\begin{align} r =  \frac{\sum xt - \frac{\sum x \sum t}{n}}{\sqrt{\left(\sum t^2 - \frac{\left(\sum t\right)^2}{n}\right)\left(\sum x^2 - \frac{\left(\sum x\right)^2}{n}\right)}} \\ = \frac{18780 - \frac{288 \times 1185}{9}}{\sqrt{\left(229725- \frac{\left(1185\right)^2}{9}\right)\left(15196 - \frac{\left(288\right)^2}{9}\right)}} ;\\ = -0.9117 = -0.912\end{align}$$;;This indicates a stronger correlation is between y and t (|r| = 0.994) and this |value| is closer to 1 than the value obtained from the linear model (|r| = 0.912).;;(ii) $$\therefore$$ Regression coefficient of y and t:;$$\begin{align} \beta_y =  \frac{\sum yt - \frac{\sum y \sum t}{n}}{\sum t^2 - \frac{\left(\sum t\right)^2}{n}} ;\\ = \frac{2639.8 - \frac{26.959 \times 1185}{9}}{229725- \frac{\left(1185\right)^2}{9}};\\ = -0.01234;\\ \overline{y} = \frac{\sum y}{n} = \frac{26.959}{9} = 2.995\end{align}$$;;$$\therefore$$ Equation of regression line of y on t:;$$\begin{align} y - \overline{y} = \beta_y(t-\overline{t});\\ \Rightarrow y - 2.995 = -0.01234(t-131.67);\\ \Rightarrow y = -0.01234t + 4.621;\\ \Rightarrow y = -0.0123t + 4.62 \space (from \space GC) \end{align}$$;;When the drug concentration (x) is 15 micrograms per litre,;$$\begin{align}\Rightarrow y = \ln 15;\\ \Rightarrow \ln 15 = 4.62 - 0.0123t;\\ t = 155.02 \end{align}$$;;$$\therefore$$ The best estimate of time when drug concentration is 15 mg $$\ell^{-1}$$: t = 155min
